commit_message:
Add command line option for build threads

In slow environments it makes sense to limit building threads for
small count to prevent overload on disk and cpu.
Support option to limit threads for specific number.

Related-Bug: #1901753

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/760075
Change-Id: Ibc94b0389392333aff15873e43607051b639f600

commit_message:
Support configuration of threads count in containers build

In slow environments we would like to limit threads while
building containers, support passing "workers" amount to
buildah.BuildahBuilder.

See patch in tripleoclient: https://review.opendev.org/760076
Related-Bug: #1901753
Change-Id: I25de4a93ea8dd309c3a599f6f694cca077c0ec04

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-19 17:48:00.000000000', 'message': 'Improve ping test coverage during update.

The ping test starts at the beginning of the "update run" phase and
stops after it finishes. This means after all roles has been updated.

With this patch we stop, test and restart the ping in-between each
role update.

This mean

 1. that we detect error earlier;
 2. we detect error related to new flow being created during update
    run;

The point 2. was discovered to be an important test as ovn can have
existing flow still working, but new flow breaking. With this new
behavior for the ping test we catch such error.

The downside is that we have even more sensible to any % based testing
as the same number of error will give you an higher percentage as we
spend less time in the test for each run. This could be seen as
another improvement.

When we doing batch update (all roles in parallel) we deactivate that
mechanism and fall back to the previous one as there is no in-between
role step there.

Change-Id: I7f30f5361773b96de13325f5038c89477b575e65
'}, {'created': '2020-11-19 17:51:23.000000000', 'message': 'Improve ping test coverage during update.

The ping test starts at the beginning of the "update run" phase and
stops after it finishes. This means after all roles has been updated.

With this patch we stop, test and restart the ping in-between each
role update.

This mean

 1. that we detect error earlier;
 2. we detect error related to new flow being created during update
    run;

The point 2. was discovered to be an important test as ovn can have
existing flow still working, but new flow breaking. With this new
behavior for the ping test we catch such error.

The downside is that we have even more sensible to any % based testing
as the same number of error will give you an higher percentage as we
spend less time in the test for each run. This could be seen as
another improvement.

We're splitting the ping test into two stages so that if the ping
fails to start (as it would be for this particular issue) we would
detect it immediately instead of waiting for the end of the run.

When we doing batch update (all roles in parallel) we deactivate that
mechanism and fall back to the previous one as there is no in-between
role step there.

Change-Id: I7f30f5361773b96de13325f5038c89477b575e65

subdirectory as I had an issue in local testing where one subdirectory

commit_message:
Improve ping test coverage during update.

The ping test starts at the beginning of the "update run" phase and
stops after it finishes. This means after all roles has been updated.

With this patch we stop, test and restart the ping in-between each
role update.

This means:

 1. that we detect error earlier;
 2. we detect error related to new flow being created during update
    run;

The point 2. was discovered to be an important test as ovn can have
existing flow still working, but new flow breaking. With this new
behavior for the ping test we catch such error.

The downside is that we have even more sensible to any % based testing
as the same number of error will give you an higher percentage as we
spend less time in the test for each run. This could be seen as
another improvement.

We're splitting the ping test into two stages so that if the ping
fails to start (as it would be for this particular issue) we would
detect it immediately instead of waiting for the end of the run.

When we doing batch update (all roles in parallel) we deactivate that
mechanism and fall back to the previous one as there is no in-between
role step there.

We also prevent the stop ping from searching into all home
subdirectory as I had an issue in local testing where one subdirectory
had unreadable files (after a local podman run). This shouldn't happen
in CI, but is good to have for local testing.

Change-Id: I7f30f5361773b96de13325f5038c89477b575e65

Set Stein status to Extended Maintenance

Project's last releases in Stein have been tagged with stein-em.
Now indicate that Stein is in Extended Maintenance phase also at
https://releases.openstack.org

commit_message:
[neutron] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: I7f542c2e898e9a828509cc8a801a96442ae93762

commit_message:
Add magnum tempest URL

Since magnum does not have valid way to define type of endpoint,
we hardcode aio private IP, so that it was used during tempest tests.

Change-Id: Ifd43f4292420da31512c001e2caad5f924e566d2
(cherry picked from commit 03353d998a2cc0fe8fdac358c16e70a47f1ff029)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-17 13:06:31.000000000', 'message': 'Rehome api tests for propagate_uplink_status

Since [0] was merged propagate_uplink_status value is True,
tempest (and neutron-tempest-plugin) is branchless, so
test_create_port_without_propagate_uplink_status and
test_create_port_with_propagate_uplink_status can be moved to
fullstack tests to keep the coverage.

Issues:
- On ussuri the default value for propagate_uplink_status was False, so
the test_create_port_without_propagate_uplink_status test asserts False.
see [1]
- On train there is no dhcp_scheduler_class attribute for
EnvironmentDescription
- On stein EnvironmentDescription has no has_placement & placement_port
attributes, and the related logic.

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/744208
[1]: https://review.opendev.org/744210

Change-Id: I8dfe76e75aa932e587d91f475317b7bac1f02ed9
Related-Bug: #1890842
(cherry picked from commit d2f8a2bea8eab491b626a66a847883fe8ac871e6)
(cherry picked from commit 5ac50b220e69ad1717e3528545bb4279a7dcf187)
'}]
commit_message:
Rehome api tests for propagate_uplink_status

Since [0] was merged propagate_uplink_status value is True,
tempest (and neutron-tempest-plugin) is branchless, so
test_create_port_without_propagate_uplink_status and
test_create_port_with_propagate_uplink_status can be moved to
fullstack tests to keep the coverage.

Issues:
- On ussuri the default value for propagate_uplink_status was False, so
the test_create_port_without_propagate_uplink_status test asserts False.
see [1]
- On train there is no dhcp_scheduler_class attribute for
EnvironmentDescription
- On stein EnvironmentDescription has no has_placement & placement_port
attributes, and the related logic.

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/744208
[1]: https://review.opendev.org/744210

Change-Id: I8dfe76e75aa932e587d91f475317b7bac1f02ed9
Related-Bug: #1890842
(cherry picked from commit d2f8a2bea8eab491b626a66a847883fe8ac871e6)
(cherry picked from commit 5ac50b220e69ad1717e3528545bb4279a7dcf187)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-23 11:31:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix AttributeError in the project instance detail view

The previous code does not handle a case where admin-specific attributes
do not exist. This leads to AttributeError in the project instance detail
page as these attributes are not included in the response from nova API.

Change-Id: I4c2942960259782d47c6777394dec6888959e26c
Closes-Bug: #1905024
(cherry picked from commit a20a275ef5cae1b38ead1c3191dd96a042eb2070)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix AttributeError in the project instance detail view

The previous code does not handle a case where admin-specific attributes
do not exist. This leads to AttributeError in the project instance detail
page as these attributes are not included in the response from nova API.

Change-Id: I4c2942960259782d47c6777394dec6888959e26c
Closes-Bug: #1905024
(cherry picked from commit a20a275ef5cae1b38ead1c3191dd96a042eb2070)

commit_message:
Make role fit to the OSA standards

We've pulled that role from github, and we need to make
an adjustments to standardize approach across all other
roles, like service and db create, uwsgi usage, etc.

We're also adding integrated CI.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/756310
Change-Id: Ie95b9c723f29eb20f9e1e95e284d7ed20346aaff

commit_message:
Use validation framework for running undercloud checkdisk

The validations playbook is own and moved under the VF
ansible dir.
The undercloud preflight check should use VF for running it.

Change-Id: Id853b1e80d690734ac9c32a1b914e49608f6cc43
(cherry picked from commit 3dd2c83883960bd279e82b9fb0d4a3cb16c5e2cb)

messages:

Again this is a rework that makes the eventual changes in I4abbe30505a5e4ccba16027addd6d5f45066e31b clean so I'm okay with this on stable."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2020-11-26 14:32:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/764328/1 : FAILURE in 2h 54m 25s'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-11-26 15:45:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I agree with Lee. Clean doc fix backport, merged in ussuri. LGTM.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-26 11:36:03.000000000', 'message': 'docs: Change order of PCI configuration steps

It doesn't really make sense to describe the "higher level"
configuration steps necessary for PCI passthrough before describing
things like BIOS configuration. Simply switch the ordering.

Change-Id: I4ea1d9a332d6585ce2c0d5a531fa3c4ad9c89482
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1852727
(cherry picked from commit 557728abaf0c822f2b1a5cdd4fb2e11e19d8ead7)
'}]
commit_message:
docs: Change order of PCI configuration steps

It doesn't really make sense to describe the "higher level"
configuration steps necessary for PCI passthrough before describing
things like BIOS configuration. Simply switch the ordering.

Change-Id: I4ea1d9a332d6585ce2c0d5a531fa3c4ad9c89482
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1852727
(cherry picked from commit 557728abaf0c822f2b1a5cdd4fb2e11e19d8ead7)

commit_message:
docs: Rework the PCI passthrough guides

Rewrite the document, making the following changes:

- Remove use of bullet points in favour of more descriptive steps
- Cross-reference various configuration options
- Emphasise that ``[pci] alias`` must be set on both controller and
  compute node
- Style nits, such as fixing the header style

Change-Id: I2ac7df7d235f0af25f5a99bc8f6abddbae2cb3af
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1852727
(cherry picked from commit d5259abfe163058b13ad943ad16a5c281c2080e7)

commit_message:
Allow kwargs in create_floating_ip

As a part of the scenario/manager.py stabilization tracked by
the below BP the patch adds kwargs argument for create_floating_ip
method so that the consumers are able to pass additional parameters
if needed.

Implements: blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable
Change-Id: Ia84a65621713d05564f9bf1107fb04f9a9b3314d

[{'created': '2020-09-17 09:15:55.000000000', 'message': 'Gather facts on localhost before running {enroll,deploy}-dynamic

We need them to learn the IP address of the network_interface,
which, in turn, is needed for the default value of ironic_url.

Change-Id: Ib884c739457fa6e4d0159441c2ae855af61c55c1
'}, {'created': '2020-09-18 08:38:34.000000000', 'message': 'Gather facts on localhost before running {enroll,deploy}-dynamic

We need them to learn the IP address of the network_interface,
which, in turn, is needed for the default value of ironic_url.

Change-Id: Ib884c739457fa6e4d0159441c2ae855af61c55c1
'}, {'created': '2020-09-18 09:51:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix internal_ip detection in {enroll,deploy}-dynamic

Gather facts on localhost before running them to learn the IP
address of the network_interface, which, in turn, is needed
for the default value of ironic_url.

Do not try to fetch interface information from target hosts,
best case it will fail, worst case - will provide IP information
from hosts themselves.

Change-Id: Ib884c739457fa6e4d0159441c2ae855af61c55c1
'}]
commit_message:
Fix internal_ip detection in {enroll,deploy}-dynamic

Gather facts on localhost before running them to learn the IP
address of the network_interface, which, in turn, is needed
for the default value of ironic_url.

Do not try to fetch interface information from target hosts,
best case it will fail, worst case - will provide IP information
from hosts themselves.

Change-Id: Ib884c739457fa6e4d0159441c2ae855af61c55c1

commit_message:
test-bifrost: use existing playbooks

Currently test-bifrost.yaml contains mostly copy-pastes from other
playbooks, make it import them instead.

This is a preparational step for the removal of test-bifrost.yaml
in favour of making test-bifrost.sh do exactly the same thing we
document for end users.

Change-Id: Id59da31dfe97c840ef5bee223c56245cc127c952

commit_message:
Include nova::pci class in compute nodes

In case of pci passthrough the pci alias need also be configured
on the compute nodes to resize guests with pci device. [1]

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/train/admin/pci-passthrough.html#configure-pci-devices-compute

Change-Id: I7f145708ae5f151fbe6ff802d0b0879956e999ff

commit_message:
Fix miscellaneous bugs found in VNF scaling guide

This patch addresses below mention issues,
* Fix missing articles in the sentences.
* Change the old link [1] present in the document referring Tacker
  TOSCA template to the desired link [2].
* Mix conventions used in the guide for the word "Tacker".
* Indent command console output.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tacker/tree/master/samples/tosca-templates/vnfd
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/src/branch/master/samples/tosca-templates/vnfd

Change-Id: Iec38f78772367035fa434eb61151f5f058b51887
Closes-Bug: #1903958

commit_message:
Adding --check-defaults to validator

When troubleshooting, it's often interesting to see the deltas between
the default or sample configs and the running configuration. The
oslo_config.validator is a great tool to integrate this feature across
all projects. It can also be easily captured by data collection tools
like sosreports with the current deployment packages.

Change-Id: I172d82f19a81282093b0d5f7ae4c1817801cd887
Signed-off-by: David Vallee Delisle <dvd@redhat.com>

commit_message:
React to `source` or `key` changes

After changing the `source` or `key` in the configuration,
the `config-changed` hook was activated, but did not call `add_source`
and `apt_update`.
This logic has been added to the `config-changed` hook as well as
the state changed to `blocked` if the addition of a new source
or key fails.

Closes-Bug: #1893034
Change-Id: I0e7afd5a06c4945341329dd96e8eef3016367386

commit_message:
Add nrpe support

Parses services() available, and uses charmhelpers' haproxy checks to
set default checks for Heat. By enabling nrpe-external-master interface,
we also allow hacluster subordinate application to be monitored for
check_crm and pacemakerd.

Change-Id: I4ad2b1c514099f9b6fe352cdab65587780915e5c
Closes-Bug: 1664745
Signed-off-by: Alvaro Uria <alvaro.uria@canonical.com>

[{'created': '2020-11-17 17:16:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix octavia tempest tests

Because of bind-to-mgmt, octavia now listens only on internal/admin URL
until [1] got merged.
To fix tempest jobs in the meanwhile, we should
externaly set to use internal endpoint for interaction.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/733408

Change-Id: Iecb8daff36c89aa54516cd1f35e376e38b7fe64d
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/755576
(cherry picked from commit eae210982469d3fdb190e61acb6d19df5f008374)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix octavia tempest tests

Because of bind-to-mgmt, octavia now listens only on internal/admin URL
until [1] got merged.
To fix tempest jobs in the meanwhile, we should
externaly set to use internal endpoint for interaction.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/733408

Change-Id: Iecb8daff36c89aa54516cd1f35e376e38b7fe64d
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/755576
(cherry picked from commit eae210982469d3fdb190e61acb6d19df5f008374)

commit_message:
Remove parameter nova::compute::pci_passthrough

The pci_passthrough parameter is deprecated. Please use
nova::compute::pci::passthrough instead.

Change-Id: Iccf86f42448d2e7e682728cb82808f91b6d8124e

commit_message:
Allow kwargs in _get_server_port_id_and_ip4

As a part of the scenario/manager.py stabilization tracked by
the below BP the patch adds kwargs argument for
_get_server_port_id_and_ip4 method so that the consumers
are able to pass additional parameters if needed.

Change-Id: Ib5f51c7899cc81f76b247474e332f43583658875
Implements: blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable

commit_message:
Revert "[Security] fix allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 issue"

This reverts commit 551130e9f4e8c89821d73881ad8e90a0208adb3e.

Reason for revert: This breaks backward compatibility between agents and neutron-server.

Change-Id: Ie7f84e5a53ad4208fcd17187bdb9f0cf39245fe8
Closes-Bug: #1903531

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-23 07:43:09.000000000', 'message': 'Change qemu user id to match previous releases

The qemu user on the host gets created using uid/gid 107. Certificates
on the host, but also the vhost-user sockets created by ovs use this
uid/gid. With the move to TCIB images the default kolla id were
reverted and the previous overwrite dropped. This make e.g. the qemu
processes to fail to use the libvirt-vnc bind mounted certificates.
This change brings back the previous overwrite of the qemu user
uid/gid.

Closes-Bug: #1903508
Related-Bug: #1900986

Change-Id: I54b9d9f341b521b415a6dccc6c78ae7a77821f6f
(cherry picked from commit 222c67e128620cfd4cc0d65ddd15d73991d486d6)
'}]
commit_message:
Change qemu user id to match previous releases

The qemu user on the host gets created using uid/gid 107. Certificates
on the host, but also the vhost-user sockets created by ovs use this
uid/gid. With the move to TCIB images the default kolla id were
reverted and the previous overwrite dropped. This make e.g. the qemu
processes to fail to use the libvirt-vnc bind mounted certificates.
This change brings back the previous overwrite of the qemu user
uid/gid.

Closes-Bug: #1903508
Related-Bug: #1900986

Change-Id: I54b9d9f341b521b415a6dccc6c78ae7a77821f6f
(cherry picked from commit 222c67e128620cfd4cc0d65ddd15d73991d486d6)

commit_message:
Use the UBI8 image for testing

This change converts our use of CentOS7/88 to UBI8, which should
provide a better test environment which will match that of
production for future releases of TripleO. While this image change
will better match production clouds thanks in large part to TCIB,
it will also remove our use of docker.io (dockerhub) which fraught
with peril due to the ongoing API rate limits saga.

Change-Id: I69f3400568d865c1f3505913077ecd7fe36d7d43
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2020-11-24 06:20:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix conditionals/types in check_flavors and verify_profiles

Existing resources "DISK_GB", "MEMORY_MB", "VCPU" were not considered to
be available in case of custom_resource_class_val == False, also use correct
types for resource comparison and required_count calculation.

Change-Id: Ia194cebaeb7dcc40b4011e50cdde7648b4bf87b1
Closes-Bug: #1905018
(cherry picked from commit 3221727a8d56d9edb8f6b3dd4cdfb0094b49f757)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix conditionals/types in check_flavors and verify_profiles

Existing resources "DISK_GB", "MEMORY_MB", "VCPU" were not considered to
be available in case of custom_resource_class_val == False, also use correct
types for resource comparison and required_count calculation.

Change-Id: Ia194cebaeb7dcc40b4011e50cdde7648b4bf87b1
Closes-Bug: #1905018
(cherry picked from commit 3221727a8d56d9edb8f6b3dd4cdfb0094b49f757)

subject: Force MySQL / MariaDB log_warnings to 1
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-11-19 11:20:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/victoria.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-11-19 11:20:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit f34afbeaffa2ceee84bbb1987fc496bc8219c9a5'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-11-19 11:20:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-11-23 07:52:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-11-25 14:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-19 11:20:01.000000000', 'message': 'Force MySQL / MariaDB log_warnings to 1

This MySQL / MariaDB server value was changed
from the value 1 to 2 between MariaDB 10.1 and 10.2 [1].  The
result of this change is that any database connection which is
not gracefully closed results in a log message
"Got an error reading communication packets" in the MySQL server
log, which is misleading as it does not usually refer to any
actionable issue; real connectivity issues are always seen in
application logs and most of these messages in the server
logs are likely to be false positives due to the behavior of HAProxy.

While applications can reduce the occurence of this error by
ensuring that database connections are gracefully closed, this
is already the behavior of oslo.db and SQLAlchemy which maintains
a connection pool that closes out stale connections explicitly
when requests are made.

The majority of these warnings are likely the result of normal HAProxy
operation, where the settings "timeout client" and "timeout server"
are set to 90 minutes, such that any connection older than this
time will be non-gracefully closed by the proxy, generating
the warning.  An idle application server process will not have attended
to connections that are older than the timeout period,
leading to these connections being left for HAProxy to handle;
HAProxy's timeout behavior leading to this message in the logs has been
confirmed in local experimentation.

The application server itself is never exposed to this as upon
the start of work will always recycle any connection that is older
than its own timeout, which defaults to 60 minutes for applications
using oslo.config + oslo.db.   Without HAProxy having the capability
to close out these connections using MySQL's protocol, the messages
are unavoidable.

The message will also occur anytime an Openstack process is stopped
or killed for all connections that are pooled in that process.

The correct way to diagnose if an application is having connectivity
issues is to look in the application server log itself for error
messages and stack traces that have much more detail as to the context
that produced a particular error message.   This warning is also
known to occur when an application server is not able to respond
to packets quickly enough as has been observed with services
such as Cinder where eventlet monkeypatching causes the PyMySQL
client to be blocked; however when this occurs, there is an
informative stack trace and error message in the application logs
that shows what's going on.

As this particular warning message is not useful in that most
occurences will refer to normal behavior as designed, the
log level should be forced to "1" to prevent these messages

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/upgrading-from-mariadb-101-to-mariadb-102/#incompatible-changes-between-101-and-102

commit_message:
Force MySQL / MariaDB log_warnings to 1

This MySQL / MariaDB server value was changed
from the value 1 to 2 between MariaDB 10.1 and 10.2 [1].  The
result of this change is that any database connection which is
not gracefully closed results in a log message
"Got an error reading communication packets" in the MySQL server
log, which is misleading as it does not usually refer to any
actionable issue; real connectivity issues are always seen in
application logs and most of these messages in the server
logs are likely to be false positives due to the behavior of HAProxy.

While applications can reduce the occurence of this error by
ensuring that database connections are gracefully closed, this
is already the behavior of oslo.db and SQLAlchemy which maintains
a connection pool that closes out stale connections explicitly
when requests are made.

The majority of these warnings are likely the result of normal HAProxy
operation, where the settings "timeout client" and "timeout server"
are set to 90 minutes, such that any connection older than this
time will be non-gracefully closed by the proxy, generating
the warning.  An idle application server process will not have attended
to connections that are older than the timeout period,
leading to these connections being left for HAProxy to handle;
HAProxy's timeout behavior leading to this message in the logs has been
confirmed in local experimentation.

The application server itself is never exposed to this as upon
the start of work will always recycle any connection that is older
than its own timeout, which defaults to 60 minutes for applications
using oslo.config + oslo.db.   Without HAProxy having the capability
to close out these connections using MySQL's protocol, the messages
are unavoidable.

The message will also occur anytime an Openstack process is stopped
or killed for all connections that are pooled in that process.

The correct way to diagnose if an application is having connectivity
issues is to look in the application server log itself for error
messages and stack traces that have much more detail as to the context
that produced a particular error message.   This warning is also
known to occur when an application server is not able to respond
to packets quickly enough as has been observed with services
such as Cinder where eventlet monkeypatching causes the PyMySQL
client to be blocked; however when this occurs, there is an
informative stack trace and error message in the application logs
that shows what's going on.

As this particular warning message is not useful in that most
occurences will refer to normal behavior as designed, the
log level should be forced to "1" to prevent these messages
as they are causing confusion in downstream environments.

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/upgrading-from-mariadb-101-to-mariadb-102/#incompatible-changes-between-101-and-102

Change-Id: I0efb4f77aaceda635c8983d6b7a240171a7accdc

commit_message:
Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: I7c461005b2686e50dc8affd9bf2ecb0115654bec
Closes-Bug: #1904962

commit_message:
Remove tht/tc/ta/tv update before UC upgrade.

After [0] merged, we are not required to run a tripleo-common,
tripleo-heat-templates, tripleo-ansible and tripleo-validations
package update as it will be performed by the undercloud upgrade
command itself.

This patch removes it from tripleo-upgrade. However, this can't be
backported to stable/train or older releases.

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/55c99266c9b589de93e3191cdd4d147e722fdf4a

Change-Id: I25cbeab46f7eeb1d24b104d8bcc2883af68492b0
(cherry picked from commit f820078ecf7b7aa4de988994f77bb23b3491474a)

commit_message:
Update networkx version in PY2

When networkx<=2.1 and short snapshots_interval (for example 60s),
the error "NetworkXError: SubGraph Views are readonly. Mutations
not allowed" is very easy to occur when applying complex template
scenarios.

Change-Id: Ia220eed46e3364d486cc64166c7285d087129c5f

commit_message:
Fix pygments_style

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

more info : http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ia6dafb44a140f8a5fd4f55682d9fb34967e7643c

commit_message:
Allow kwargs in create_volume

As a part of the scenario/manager.py stabilization tracked by
the below BP the patch adds kwargs argument for create_volume
method so that the consumers are able to pass additional
parameters if needed.

Closes-Bug: #1899753
Implements: blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable
Change-Id: I36107992256bd6816b2ab2e40b783279952c6eeb

commit_message:
Allow kwargs in boot_instance_from_resource

As a part of the scenario/manager.py stabilization tracked by the
below BP the patch adds kwargs argument for boot_instance_from_resource
method so that the consumers are able to pass additional parameters
if needed.

Implements: blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable
Change-Id: I1db7209bc9639211983b0cb39264962add6f3363

subject: Update share access to "ro" during writing operation
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-26 08:06:13.000000000', 'message': 'Update share access to "ro" during writing operation

This test checks for asynchronous operations.
The test perform writing to a share and during the writing
operation changing the access level to "ro".
The test verifies the share is accessible and some of the
data has been written to it.

Note: This test revealed a new bug [1], so the gates are
      supposed to fail.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1905427

Change-Id: I4a184f639ab6651c6ab278ffe4e6f1d894105c37
'}]
commit_message:
Update share access to "ro" during writing operation

This test checks for asynchronous operations.
The test perform writing to a share and during the writing
operation changing the access level to "ro".
The test verifies the share is accessible and some of the
data has been written to it.

Note: This test revealed a new bug [1], so the gates are
      supposed to fail.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1905427

Change-Id: I4a184f639ab6651c6ab278ffe4e6f1d894105c37

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-17 09:26:18.000000000', 'message': "Add a validation to check the local.

I don't know how to explain how it happens, but we have had several
customers case[1], for example, different local for writing to the database
and reading. What causes an error during minor update, the keystone
client calls the command to list the openstack projects. So we have a
python unicode error. For rabbitmq we force the utf-8 local, so we
decided that we assume that we must be in utf-8 everywhere. Add this
validation to ensure the local system is configure with the good local.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1824513

Change-Id: I8b8f2a17a4963af46dd2c5407fb089414a804247
(cherry picked from commit 6521f1b81adf9502bc2ab10fa72fd75b20348037)

commit_message:
Add a validation to check the local.

I don't know how to explain how it happens, but we have had several
customers case[1], for example, different local for writing to the database
and reading. What causes an error during minor update, the keystone
client calls the command to list the openstack projects. So we have a
python unicode error. For rabbitmq we force the utf-8 local, so we
decided that we assume that we must be in utf-8 everywhere. Add this
validation to ensure the local system is configure with the good local.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1824513

Change-Id: I8b8f2a17a4963af46dd2c5407fb089414a804247
(cherry picked from commit 6521f1b81adf9502bc2ab10fa72fd75b20348037)

> I was testing this locally and it seems to work for openvswitch fw
 > driver but don't work for iptables_hybrid driver. My test is
 > described in http://paste.openstack.org/show/790889/
 > The same test done for openvswitch driver and it seems to be
 > working fine.

This patch will not intend to fix the iptables_hybrid driver to make changes small and simple. And I may also wonder if it is worth to fix while there is a potential plan to deprecate it. Yes, it is needed for stable branches. So IMO I should update the commit message to clarify this is the fix for openflow firewall only."}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2020-03-21 09:55:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2020-03-21 11:59:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-12 09:55:18.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Fix: Allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0

Change-Id: I2e3aa7c400d7bb17cc117b65faaa160b41013dde
Closes-bug: #1867119
'}, {'created': '2020-03-12 13:49:23.000000000', 'message': "[Security] fix allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 issue

When add allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 to one port, it will
unexpectedly open all others' protocol under same security
group. IPv6 has the same problem.

The root cause is the openflow rules calculation of the
security group, it will unexpectedly allow all IP(4&6)
traffic to get through.

This patch removes the allowed-address-pair IP list from
the security openflow rules calculation.

Test result shows that the remote security group and
allowed address pair works:
1. Port has 0.0.0.0/0 allowed-address-pair clould send any
   IP (src) packet out.
2. Ports under same network can reach each other (remote
   security group).
3. Protocol port number could be accessed only when there
   has related rule.

Closes-bug: #1867119
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712054/
Change-Id: I2e3aa7c400d7bb17cc117b65faaa160b41013dde
"}, {'created': '2020-03-14 16:40:45.000000000', 'message': "[Security] fix allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 issue

When add allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 to one port, it will
unexpectedly open all others' protocol under same security
group. IPv6 has the same problem.

The root cause is the openflow rules calculation of the
security group, it will unexpectedly allow all IP(4&6)
traffic to get through.

This patch removes the allowed-address-pair IP list from
the security openflow rules calculation.

Test result shows that the remote security group and
allowed address pair works:
1. Port has 0.0.0.0/0 allowed-address-pair clould send any
   IP (src) packet out.
2. Port has x.x.x.x/y allowed-address-pair could be accepted
   for those VMs under same security group.
3. Ports under same network can reach each other (remote
   security group).
4. Protocol port number could be accessed only when there
   has related rule.

Closes-bug: #1867119
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712054/
Change-Id: I2e3aa7c400d7bb17cc117b65faaa160b41013dde
"}, {'created': '2020-03-14 16:50:42.000000000', 'message': "[Security] fix allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 issue

When add allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 to one port, it will
unexpectedly open all others' protocol under same security
group. IPv6 has the same problem.

The root cause is the openflow rules calculation of the
security group, it will unexpectedly allow all IP(4&6)
traffic to get through.

This patch adds a source mac address match for the
allowed-address-pair which has prefix lenght 0, that means
all ethernet packets from this mac will be accepted.
It exactly will meet the request of accepting any IP address
from the configured VM.

Test result shows that the remote security group and
allowed address pair works:
1. Port has 0.0.0.0/0 allowed-address-pair clould send any
   IP (src) packet out.
2. Port has x.x.x.x/y allowed-address-pair could be accepted
   for those VMs under same security group.
3. Ports under same network can reach each other (remote
   security group).
4. Protocol port number could be accessed only when there
   has related rule.

Closes-bug: #1867119
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712054/
Change-Id: I2e3aa7c400d7bb17cc117b65faaa160b41013dde

commit_message:
[Security] fix allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 issue

When add allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 to one port, it will
unexpectedly open all others' protocol under same security
group. IPv6 has the same problem.

The root cause is the openflow rules calculation of the
security group, it will unexpectedly allow all IP(4&6)
traffic to get through.

For openvswitch openflow firewall, this patch adds a source
mac address match for the allowed-address-pair which has
prefix lenght 0, that means all ethernet packets from this
mac will be accepted. It exactly will meet the request of
accepting any IP address from the configured VM.

Test result shows that the remote security group and
allowed address pair works:
1. Port has 0.0.0.0/0 allowed-address-pair clould send any
   IP (src) packet out.
2. Port has x.x.x.x/y allowed-address-pair could be accepted
   for those VMs under same security group.
3. Ports under same network can reach each other (remote
   security group).
4. Protocol port number could be accessed only when there
   has related rule.

Closes-bug: #1867119
Change-Id: I2e3aa7c400d7bb17cc117b65faaa160b41013dde

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-31 11:22:31.000000000', 'message': "[Security] fix allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 issue

When add allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 to one port, it will
unexpectedly open all others' protocol under same security
group. IPv6 has the same problem.

The root cause is the openflow rules calculation of the
security group, it will unexpectedly allow all IP(4&6)
traffic to get through.

For openvswitch openflow firewall, this patch adds a source
mac address match for the allowed-address-pair which has
prefix lenght 0, that means all ethernet packets from this
mac will be accepted. It exactly will meet the request of
accepting any IP address from the configured VM.

Test result shows that the remote security group and
allowed address pair works:
1. Port has 0.0.0.0/0 allowed-address-pair clould send any
   IP (src) packet out.
2. Port has x.x.x.x/y allowed-address-pair could be accepted
   for those VMs under same security group.
3. Ports under same network can reach each other (remote
   security group).
4. Protocol port number could be accessed only when there
   has related rule.

Closes-bug: #1867119
Change-Id: I2e3aa7c400d7bb17cc117b65faaa160b41013dde
(cherry picked from commit 00298fe6e84cd7610b39af50e9517885a182f47c)
"}]
commit_message:
[Security] fix allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 issue

When add allowed-address-pair 0.0.0.0/0 to one port, it will
unexpectedly open all others' protocol under same security
group. IPv6 has the same problem.

The root cause is the openflow rules calculation of the
security group, it will unexpectedly allow all IP(4&6)
traffic to get through.

For openvswitch openflow firewall, this patch adds a source
mac address match for the allowed-address-pair which has
prefix lenght 0, that means all ethernet packets from this
mac will be accepted. It exactly will meet the request of
accepting any IP address from the configured VM.

Test result shows that the remote security group and
allowed address pair works:
1. Port has 0.0.0.0/0 allowed-address-pair clould send any
   IP (src) packet out.
2. Port has x.x.x.x/y allowed-address-pair could be accepted
   for those VMs under same security group.
3. Ports under same network can reach each other (remote
   security group).
4. Protocol port number could be accessed only when there
   has related rule.

Closes-bug: #1867119
Change-Id: I2e3aa7c400d7bb17cc117b65faaa160b41013dde
(cherry picked from commit 00298fe6e84cd7610b39af50e9517885a182f47c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-28 07:08:19.000000000', 'message': "Fix delete-accepted-egress-direct-flow issue on deleting VM

When VM is deleted or migrate to other compute node, the function
'delete_accepted_egress_direct_flow()' was not executed. This will
resule in stale flows in table 61. Add delete_accepted_egress_direct_flow()
in port_unbound() to ensure delete these flows.

Change-Id: I7d937e39bf67ffb31f8a82f993323e9e70d6c344
Closes-Bug: #1881070X
"}, {'created': '2020-05-30 03:23:48.000000000', 'message': "Fix delete-accepted-egress-direct-flow issue on deleting VM

commit_message:
Fix delete-accepted-egress-direct-flow issue on deleting VM

When VM is deleted or migrated to other compute node, the function
'delete_accepted_egress_direct_flow()' in process_deleted_ports()
was not executed. This will result in stale flows in table 61.
The method should be called in the port_unbound() by default to
ensure delete these flows.

In addition, use 'br_int' instead of 'self' to call delete_flows()
in delete_accepted_egress_direct_flow().

Change-Id: I7d937e39bf67ffb31f8a82f993323e9e70d6c344
Closes-Bug: #1881070

commit_message:
Fix wait condition for retry

Tenancity expects you use one it's waiting methods and not a fixed
number. This currently doesn't retry and stops all builds from
continuing to run.

Change-Id: Ia2b61cb698677968ef990d5577918be3aa4e2450
Closes-Bug: #1904025
(cherry picked from commit 52112d428defc2d2d03ba7a0b261cc4c51f50765)

dlrn_hash_tag is meant to be named like current-tripleo,

commit_message:
Handle DLRN hash in consumer upgrade jobs

dlrn_hash_tag is meant to be named like current-tripleo,
tripleo-ci-testing etc, but with switch to provider/consumer
jobs aggregate/commit hashes are being used as dlrn_hash_tag.

Make repo-setup to handle the case where dlrn_hash_tag is
equivalent to an aggregate hash.

Closes-Bug: #1905034
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/763711
Change-Id: I098de6def27fbaa47a9cf84ccdf0af085a2db901

Then we can keep the current name to be consistent with these existing parameters...'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2020-11-26 00:52:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-23 01:39:44.000000000', 'message': 'Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: Ia353f278db9426d29617d6c274fef0c8b71c53e1
Closes-Bug: #1904962
'}]
commit_message:
Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: Ia353f278db9426d29617d6c274fef0c8b71c53e1
Closes-Bug: #1904962

commit_message:
Add support for GlusterFS NFS Manila backend

Follows existing backends patterns to add support for the GlusterFS
NFS driver.
NFS server type used by the GlusterFS backend, Gluster or Ganesha,
currently supports Gluster.
The GlusterFS NFS driver needs to install the glusterfs-fuse package
in the kolla images manila share container in advance, which has been merged
in https://review.opendev.org/747510

Change-Id: I7fdb121b5bf9850d62246a24f9b17d226028c2ca
(cherry picked from commit f01492b11c81e6f5ec9773c2eb39612033992c35)

commit_message:
Replace display_name by name in scenario manager

'display_name' attribute has been used when calling create_volume
and create_volume_snapshot methods instead of the 'name' which
is the current attribute name based on the current documentation.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/
?expanded=create-a-volume-detail#create-a-volume
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/
?expanded=create-a-snapshot-detail#volume-snapshots-snapshots

Change-Id: Ie22ac7214e77c95ccd03935ffb230241218c08f1

commit_message:
Allow to specify probe interval parameter for ovn-controller

On certain systems, under load, the default probe interval (5 seconds)
may cause disconnections to OVN database from ovn-controller which
forces unnecessary reconnections and additional load.

This patch is changing the default to 30 seconds and allowing it to
be configured via puppet.

Change-Id: Id8fcedda0e7a0aa5846f8c806d994696ab8f5747
Closes-Bug: #1817732
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow kwargs in create_floating_ip

As a part of the scenario/manager.py stabilization tracked by
the below BP the patch adds kwargs argument for create_floating_ip
method so that the consumers are able to pass additional
parameters if needed.

Change-Id: Ibe6030be4386ce2723cc17950496e1661b5746c9
Implements: blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable

backward incompatible for the CLI `trove-manager datastore_version_update`.

Change-Id: I583c296f15a453bdfadf10de5c678ac483cbd4dd

commit_message:
Support --image-tags for trove-manager datastore_version_update command

image-tags was introduced in commit 1d24b65 but the implementation was
backward incompatible for the CLI `trove-manager datastore_version_update`.

This patch changes that by supporting an optional parameter `--image-tags`.

Change-Id: I583c296f15a453bdfadf10de5c678ac483cbd4dd

> (1 comment)

Yeah, you may know, there was a discussion and I agreed with that at that time.

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/542653/2/tempest/api/compute/admin/test_aggregates.py@221

I have no strong opinion right now. But I'm still unsure which way is better for testers, skip or fail.

If the situation can happen much time, I think its configuration, capacity, deployment or something is wrong. So, the test should fail to detect it. And, if the situation rarely happens, it also should fail to detect the rare thing.

I think "skipping" is good for CI stabilities, but I feel it is just a fake and we likely miss failures with that.

Anyway, this is probably just my over-thinking. So, I'd like to know others' opinion.'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2019-08-22 09:22:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17896, 'date': '2019-08-23 14:33:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2019-08-26 06:08:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I'm ok with skipping in this case, and seems it isn't worth adding a config item for choosing whether to skip it or to fail it."}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2019-08-26 17:44:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17887, 'date': '2019-08-27 00:04:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2019-08-27 08:51:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Well, I don't think we should add a config option for this case. But if we just skip this test, we easily miss the resouce shortage or an environmental issue which should not be happened often. Because people don't care skipped tests.

So, how about retrying to find enabled hosts if it happens temporarily? (Too much? or doesn't work?)

And, this describes what I wanted to tell.
https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/HACKING.html#skipping-tests
```
Skipping Tests
Skipping tests should be based on configuration only. If that is not possible, it is likely that either a configuration flag is missing, or the test should fail rather than be skipped. Using discovery for skipping tests is generally discouraged.

When running a test that requires a certain “feature” in the target cloud, if that feature is missing we should fail, because either the test configuration is invalid, or the cloud is broken and the expected “feature” is not there even if the cloud was configured with it.
```"}, {'account_id': 17896, 'date': '2019-08-29 16:39:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Is it really a resource shortage or environmental issue if all the host already belong to a zone? Why should the test assume that there exists a host that is not already in an availability zone? In a production environment all hosts could be allocated to AZs and I don't think that would be considered an environmental issue"}, {'account_id': 17887, 'date': '2019-08-30 01:10:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2020-02-18 09:09:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It depends on Masayuki's opinion:)"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-11-03 17:50:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

> Well, I don't think we should add a config option for this case.
 > But if we just skip this test, we easily miss the resouce shortage
 > or an environmental issue which should not be happened often.
 > Because people don't care skipped tests.
 > 
 > So, how about retrying to find enabled hosts if it happens
 > temporarily? (Too much? or doesn't work?)
 > 
 > And, this describes what I wanted to tell.
 > https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/HACKING.html#skipping-tests
 > ```
 > Skipping Tests
 > Skipping tests should be based on configuration only. If that is
 > not possible, it is likely that either a configuration flag is
 > missing, or the test should fail rather than be skipped. Using
 > discovery for skipping tests is generally discouraged.
 > 
 > When running a test that requires a certain “feature” in the target
 > cloud, if that feature is missing we should fail, because either
 > the test configuration is invalid, or the cloud is broken and the
 > expected “feature” is not there even if the cloud was configured
 > with it.
 > ```

As Rick mentioned this is not retry things it is how env is being configured and all host already in some AZ so adding them to aggregate is not allowed or expected so not testing that is right thing.

Why adding config option is not good as this is also not things which is done as pre configured env. This can be runtime things where operator add new host and that is not added to any AZ then this test should run and tell that new host can be added to AZ. so skipping and running based on runtime condition is ok i think."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2020-11-05 08:12:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

HACKING rst unfortunately right.
Tests should avoid auto skipping, if the skip decision based on broken openstack you can have the false impression it is working.

Probably would be better to fail instead of skip, it still can be put on blacklist in case the operator know whet is the situation.


This change got many +1/+2 vote already, this time we might make an exception, these aggregate thingies are very unusual (admin only) beasts.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-11-05 13:28:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> HACKING rst unfortunately right.
 > Tests should avoid auto skipping, if the skip decision based on
 > broken openstack you can have the false impression it is working.

 > put on blacklist in case the operator know whet is the situation.
 > 
 > 
 > This change got many +1/+2 vote already, this time we might make an
 > exception, these aggregate thingies are very unusual (admin only)
 > beasts.

Yeah I agree that those are admin only things and not so common. failing the tests means asking them to change their env setting i mean 'tempest cannot test it so failed'. I think skip in that case make more sense then fail and avoid adding it in blacklist manually."}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2020-11-24 14:56:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Skip adding host to aggregate with az if host already in other zone

Running test_aggregate_basic_ops fails if the selected host is
already in an other zone:

"Cannot add host to aggregate 1773. Reason: One or more hosts already
in availability zone(s)"

This is to find an up and enabled host that has not been added to
other zone, and skip test_aggregate_basic_ops if all hosts in
the system are already in other zones.

Change-Id: I2c196ca22c963af976b256016c36f4095ccf8f61

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-17 17:44:46.000000000', 'message': 'New option to trigger paunch configuration on only one container.

Adding the container_name option enables one to create playbook like
this:

    - hosts: Compute
      gather_facts: true
      become: true
      tasks:
        - name: update one container
          paunch:
            config: "/var/lib/tripleo-config/container-startup-config/step_4"
            config_id:
             - 'tripleo_step4'
            container_name: ovn_controller
            action: apply
            container_cli: podman
            managed_by: tripleo-Compute
            config_overrides:
              image: undercloud-0.ctlplane.redhat.local:8787/openstack-ovn-controller:16.1_20201020.1_hotfix
            cleanup: True

In this example we deliver an specific change to all Compute node
without running the entire update process.

This is only syntaxic sugar as running with:

    config: "/var/lib/tripleo-config/container-startup-config/step_4/hashed-ovn_controller.json"

has the same effect.

Note that config_overrides doesn't have the same semantic when we use
the container_name option as we don't require the user to pass the
full structure where it should be (still in the context of offering
some more convenience to the user):

   { <container_name>: {<changed_key>: <change>, ...} }

Here we prepend the container_name to the structure so that the user
focus on the container parameter.

This file has been deleted after ussuri so this patch starts at
ussuri.

Change-Id: I70ccfad3ea96dff44641bf70d459adb7cccb21d5
'}]
commit_message:
New option to trigger paunch configuration on only one container.

Adding the container_name option enables one to create playbook like
this:

    - hosts: Compute
      gather_facts: true
      become: true
      tasks:
        - name: update one container
          paunch:
            config: "/var/lib/tripleo-config/container-startup-config/step_4"
            config_id:
             - 'tripleo_step4'
            container_name: ovn_controller
            action: apply
            container_cli: podman
            managed_by: tripleo-Compute
            config_overrides:
              image: undercloud-0.ctlplane.redhat.local:8787/openstack-ovn-controller:16.1_20201020.1_hotfix
            cleanup: True

In this example we deliver an specific change to all Compute node
without running the entire update process.

This is only syntaxic sugar as running with:

    config: "/var/lib/tripleo-config/container-startup-config/step_4/hashed-ovn_controller.json"

has the same effect.

Note that config_overrides doesn't have the same semantic when we use
the container_name option as we don't require the user to pass the
full structure where it should be (still in the context of offering
some more convenience to the user):

   { <container_name>: {<changed_key>: <change>, ...} }

Here we prepend the container_name to the structure so that the user
focus on the container parameter.

This file has been deleted after ussuri so this patch starts at
ussuri.

Change-Id: I70ccfad3ea96dff44641bf70d459adb7cccb21d5

commit_message:
Set strategy free for upgrade_steps_playbook

Upgrade tasks should not have dependancy between hosts. But on
other hand we should be running OS upgrade for multiple machines.
The upgrade of composable controll plane should run on one server
of each pacemaker enabled role at once making OS upgrade to look
like this:
ctrl-0,database-0,messaging-0,networker-0
ctrl-1,database-1,messaging-1,networker-1
ctrl-2,database-2,messaging-2,networker-2

If we run role by role we get from 3*30min to 3*120min :(

Change-Id: Ic73391f9bf38328b835217efb9e5423371f989fa

When Keepalived is stopped, it brings down the VIPs which is

commit_message:
undercloud_upgrade: tear-down keepalived

Keepalived was deprecated and the VIPs are now deployed by
os-net-config.
When Keepalived is stopped, it brings down the VIPs which is
problematic since it'll remove the resources created by os-net-config
so let's teardown keepalived in the upgrade tasks here and later
during the deploy the os-net-config tool will re-create the VIPs.
Doing it at step 5 so upgrade steps which need API access still work.

Change-Id: Iee46d0394ad0b2b31da93d0a93dcfa53766fa246
Related-Bug: #1888411
(cherry picked from commit 357a3eeb291dc437d62e9663d209b27ec7f4b29a)
(cherry picked from commit aaad2cd70610ca691a0e1c1f6e5a17f269449867)

commit_message:
Adds a unique index to quotas

now table quotas not set unique index in project_id and resource,
when set quota concurrently, there may be multiple quota limit
records for the same resource.

Closes-bug: #1893314

Change-Id: I78d2a5accd81a58cf4d6f3be26942a4780f5d43f

commit_message:
Fix loop in waiter when error_ok is True

If error_ok=True is passed to wait_for_status and a resource
is in 'ERROR' status, the function infinitely loops

check_timeout value is now considered in case of ERROR statuses in
resources.

Story: 2008110
Task: 40826

Change-Id: I9d62b2f4ec55a6fd6cba38d446711c16f03a5ade

commit_message:
Add cinder backup driver for S3

Implement cinder backup driver for S3.
It supports creating and restoring backup from S3 based on the
chunkeddriver abstraction.

DocImpact

Signed-off-by: Arthur Outhenin-Chalandre <arthur@cri.epita.fr>
Change-Id: I4b444fc3d3bb796b5dd08a0750e0c5f95bbe5b05

Tagging EM only applies tags to the last release. If you have additional changes merged that you want to get into an official release before transitioning to EM, you need to propose releases to do so.

Since we are past the published EM transition date, I would recommend getting those releases proposed right away so they can be done before we cut off stein.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-11-19 17:40:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I know, we are late. Can I propose a last minute last-release stein patch and have this depend on that? Can I merge the two patches?'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2020-11-19 18:39:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

commit_message:
[sahara] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: If565ebe76c1bf11088444313a9745a58a0725eff

commit_message:
Add useful common policies to base.py

These common check strings are useful for implementing consistent
policy checks across OpenStack by adhering to a common persona. This
also includes support for a default read-only role.

Subsequent changes will update the policies to use these check strings
where applicable.

Change-Id: Ica9db41939e17fcd67b97dce5191e75bfb396330

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-13 23:15:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix config option default value for sample config file

There are multiple places where nova set the new default
value for other (than nova) namespace config option for
example oslo lib config options. Examples:

- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/20572809f2d8fefd72a7a059c4e82462a0d66262/nova/config.py#L62
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/20572809f2d8fefd72a7a059c4e82462a0d66262/nova/policy.py#L48

and these defaults are reflected in code also which is working
as expected. But when config sample file is generated via
oslo-config-generator tool (tox -egenconfig) then these defaults
which are set by Nova are not reflected as this tool take the
raw defaults. To solve this issue oslo config provide a option
to add hook to reflect the new default in config generator
- https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.config/latest/cli/generator.html#modifying-defaults-from-other-namespaces

We already doing it for middleware cors option
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/20572809f2d8fefd72a7a059c4e82462a0d66262/setup.cfg#L41

Fixing existing default value and if we find more or any future
change for default value, we need to add those config generator hook.

Change-Id: Ib0e926aec069dfb4ffd1bbfe8506d62464511b51
Closes-Bug: #904250

commit_message:
Fix config option default value for sample config file

There are multiple places where nova set the new default
value for other (than nova) namespace config option for
example oslo lib config options. Examples:

- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/20572809f2d8fefd72a7a059c4e82462a0d66262/nova/config.py#L62
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/20572809f2d8fefd72a7a059c4e82462a0d66262/nova/policy.py#L48

and these defaults are reflected in code also which is working
as expected. But when config sample file is generated via
oslo-config-generator tool (tox -egenconfig) then these defaults
which are set by Nova are not reflected as this tool take the
raw defaults. To solve this issue oslo config provide a option
to add hook to reflect the new default in config generator
- https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.config/latest/cli/generator.html#modifying-defaults-from-other-namespaces

We already doing it for middleware cors option
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/20572809f2d8fefd72a7a059c4e82462a0d66262/setup.cfg#L41

Fixing existing default value and if we find more or any future
change for default value, we need to add those config generator hook.

Change-Id: Ib0e926aec069dfb4ffd1bbfe8506d62464511b51
Closes-Bug: #1904250

commit_message:
Move to quay.io with kuryr/demo docker image.

Change documentation and tests from 'demo/kuryr' which by default will
use docker registry to 'quay.io/demo/kuryr' which will hint about
quay.io registry.

Change-Id: I7edc6bd8fed2943acf78ce2b66c44c91b1c33114

We don't want to have to remember to add the upgrade note on the first patch that requires Mimic as the minimum version."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-11-13 09:55:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > This has upgrade impact, so we need a release note to highlight it.
 >  Even if for now it would still work.  We don't want to have to
 > remember to add the upgrade note on the first patch that requires
 > Mimic as the minimum version.

FWIW, I was actually thinking the opposite. This is just documenting the policy, but we would want to make sure if/when we actually add the enforcement that we would want to make sure to include a release note making sure that was clearly highlighted. Either way works though, so whatever folks think would be the best."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-11-13 14:15:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

@Michal: reply inline.

@Gorka and @Sean: I think it makes sense to agree with both of you on this.  I'll add a release note here saying what is considered "supported" so that operators can get used to the idea, even if we don't implement anything in Wallaby that requires a minimum version.  Then we can either revise that release note or add a new one when minimum version enforcement is required in the code.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-11-13 15:05:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24921, 'date': '2020-11-13 15:42:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This patch isn't actually restricting anything, fwiw.
Are we planning on putting code checks in place for ceph versions?
If not, then this patch really doesn't do anything other than say "don't do that."   But "they" will do that. :)'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2020-11-19 09:49:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Thanks for adding the release note.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-11-23 13:54:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> This patch isn't actually restricting anything, fwiw.
> Are we planning on putting code checks in place for ceph versions?
> If not, then this patch really doesn't do anything other than say "don't do that."   But "they" will do that. :)

We had a quick discussion at the cinder meeting last week:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/cinder/2020/cinder.2020-11-18-14.00.log.html#l-180

Upshot was that it's worth saying "don't do that" so that if "they" do that, "they" should have no expectations that we will fix it.  An additional thing is that it will no longer be a big surprise when we do enforce this in the code.  I guess that brings up the issue: should we be deprecating the use of Ceph earlier than Mimic as part of this patch?'}, {'account_id': 32291, 'date': '2020-11-25 07:49:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2020-11-25 16:29:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
doc: restrict supported Ceph versions

As discussed at the PTG [0] and subsequent Cinder meetings [1],
set a minimum supported version of Ceph.  Also specify that we
expect the Ceph client and server versions to be in alignment.

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CinderWallabyPTGSummary#Ceph:_Minimum_supported_version
[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/cinder/2020/cinder.2020-11-11-14.00.log.html#l-202

Change-Id: Ifd4cf76158350f60f84e3066ff41cc6ac5c2a3c3

commit_message:
Do not install tempest plugin in train environments

Since train is a python2 env, expand the check in the
devstack plugin to not install the tempest plugin since
it is python3-only.

Change-Id: I67027090a8cc340b85fb1119f0e52bc1f2ffc66d

commit_message:
Add Python3 Wallaby unit tests

This change ensures unit testing is in place for all of the tested
runtimes for Wallaby.

See also the Project Testing Interface (PTI) in OpenStack Governance.
[1]

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I9400872aa79abc35ed92e77d4823748619415536

commit_message:
Fix create/update_port with python3

unescape_port_kwargs() in api/neutron.py changes a key of dict
during the iteration and it is not allowed in python3.

Change-Id: Ifc1b9a0191aacd32e8c8ecc082b6313f04003f63
Closes-Bug: #1900851

have a couple of questions and requests:
- Can you link the neutron fix for supporting this tagging?
- What is what has been added? Tagging the ports at the creation time or option to tag X ports in a bulk operation?
- You need to "discover" that functionality rather than setting it always as Kuryr may run in envs with older Neutron not supporting this option. Similar things were done for Octavia support, so you can take a look at that for an example'}, {'account_id': 32533, 'date': '2020-11-12 10:45:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> have a couple of questions and requests:
 > - Can you link the neutron fix for supporting this tagging?
 > - What is what has been added? Tagging the ports at the creation
 > time or option to tag X ports in a bulk operation?
 > - You need to "discover" that functionality rather than setting it
 > always as Kuryr may run in envs with older Neutron not supporting
 > this option. Similar things were done for Octavia support, so you
 > can take a look at that for an example

Right, thanks. Sorry about my late response. The link to the fix can be found here[1]. According to one of the authors, the tags are to be attached to each port in the bulk POST request[2]. I will check out the Octavia example, thank you.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1815933
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1815933#3'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2020-11-12 10:55:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> have a couple of questions and requests:
 > - Can you link the neutron fix for supporting this tagging?

https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1815933
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700755/

 > - What is what has been added? Tagging the ports at the creation
 > time or option to tag X ports in a bulk operation?

If I read this correctly it's basically allowing `tags` field on port creation requests (both bulk and single), so the former.

 > - You need to "discover" that functionality rather than setting it
 > always as Kuryr may run in envs with older Neutron not supporting
 > this option. Similar things were done for Octavia support, so you
 > can take a look at that for an example

Right, so in this case you'll need to use find_extension [1] to check if 'tag-ports-during-bulk-creation' extension is enabled. If the extension is not available it's needed to use the regular way of tagging resources. Please make sure to cache that call like it's done on [2]

The fortunate part is that according to discussion on [3] no changes to openstacksdk are needed.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/blob/ef43a9ffb1c946d64f25c081a802117d248a4ae2/openstack/network/v2/_proxy.py#L354-L369
[2] https://github.com/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/blob/d26133a02d9306e1561bca5f29dcb7203fe2b9c7/kuryr_kubernetes/controller/drivers/lbaasv2.py#L71-L89

commit_message:
Support for bulk port tagging extension

With the recent support added to Neutron to allow adding a tag to multiple
Ports at one call, this change stops Kuryr from performing two separate
requests to create the Ports and then Tagging them and just does it one
request.

Change-Id: I09496a9cd9cce4c3ae2c6a75c242aa46fa79a07d
Closes-Bug: #1899028

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I68d6faca20e5d8f1523dbd9f3e4f077a2680aa18

commit_message:
Ensure egress NP works with Service without selectors

This commit ensures egress Network policy can also work with
services without selectors.

Change-Id: I26e1dce0b6e363f027ee6d4dfea99053ffe80bbe

use intersphinx.  Also modifies the tox 'docs' and 'api-ref' envs
to copy the sphinx object inventory files generated during a build
over to the releasenotes directory and puts them under version
control so that they're available to the Zuul release notes jobs.

Change-Id: I5b47b41368c0dff5d96c96556f3ccbed1933539b
"}]
commit_message:
Add intersphinx support for release notes

Adds the appropriate config and some documentation about how to
use intersphinx.  Also modifies the tox 'docs' and 'api-ref' envs
to copy the sphinx object inventory files generated during a build
over to the releasenotes directory and puts them under version
control so that they're available to the Zuul release notes jobs.

Change-Id: I5b47b41368c0dff5d96c96556f3ccbed1933539b

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/q/project:%255Eopenstack/puppet-.*+is:open+branch:stable/stein"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-11-12 10:14:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think this is a kind of tagging to say that we no longer create a new release, but we still keep stable/stein branch open, right ?

I think we can create stein-em tag now. The open patch for puppet-openstack-integration is a kind of CI stuff and I don't think any user is actually consuming that. We need to land that patch to fix ci problems but we can merge this as long as the branch is open."}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-11-12 11:07:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Takashi @Tobias the branch remains open for bugfix backports, but there won't be official releases anymore. commit_message:
[Puppet OpenStack] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Icdd4a7b14f35ee51b614e530f05ace76dfad4665

[{'created': '2020-11-23 01:40:11.000000000', 'message': 'Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: I4a3941c5a21560c6246d22e89d4566dcdc95bfd6
Closes-Bug: #1904962
'}]
commit_message:
Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: I4a3941c5a21560c6246d22e89d4566dcdc95bfd6
Closes-Bug: #1904962

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Change-Id: Id6ba4f68472205d9c8c0c43da7c1dc07042bc1c1
Sem-Ver: feature

I'm in favor of this, the usefulness to the customer is clear and I think it brings things into parity nicely with similar products."}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-11-06 18:46:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-11-19 15:31:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-11-26 23:17:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Given the pain and suffering we are seeing from the user having access to the vip port, I am pretty against this idea of also opening the SG. It is also not how we agreed to solve this at the PTGs.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-11-27 08:25:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Given the pain and suffering we are seeing from the user having
 > access to the vip port, I am pretty against this idea of also
 > opening the SG. It is also not how we agreed to solve this at the
 > PTGs.

The pain from the VIP comes due to the fact that the port is not attached anywhere due to using allow_address_pairs to permit it's traffic into the amphora VM. Again, this is not the case for the SG. A user cannot delete this SG (unlike the VIP port) if the amphora VM is using it."}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-12-11 18:15:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-12-11 18:18:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-12-13 10:42:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-12-13 10:50:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-12-13 15:00:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-12-13 15:01:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-12-13 15:02:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-12-13 16:28:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Cherry Picked

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-14 08:01:12.000000000', 'message': 'Enabling SG customization on loadbalancer listerners

By changing the SG ownership to belong to the tenant creating the
loadbalancer we allow the tenant to define more fine grain access
policies their loadbalancer, such as only enabling access to a given
port/protocol from a given remote id or subnet CIDR -- instead of
having to open that port/protocol from everywhere.

As this security group is only used for the amphora VM created for
the specific load balancer, and the user could already open access
to it through listeners on any port, protocol, giving full access to
modify the SG will not entitle any extra security concern.

Note this can be a temporal solution until Octavia enables this
flexibility through their own API

Story: 2003686

commit_message:
Enabling SG customization on loadbalancer listerners

By changing the SG ownership to belong to the tenant creating the
loadbalancer we allow the tenant to define more fine grain access
policies their loadbalancer, such as only enabling access to a given
port/protocol from a given remote id or subnet CIDR -- instead of
having to open that port/protocol from everywhere.

As this security group is only used for the amphora VM created for
the specific load balancer, and the user could already open access
to it through listeners on any port, protocol, giving full access to
modify the SG will not entitle any extra security concern.

Note this can be a temporal solution until Octavia enables this
flexibility through their own API

Change-Id: I2346c8a3f2fa4b4eb8a004b4aaab93986228c371
Story: 2003686

commit_message:
libvirt: Wire up a force disconnect_volume flag

I058ff0a0e5ad517507dc3cda39087c913558561d introduced a force flag for
disconnect_volume into the os-brick connector classes in 1.14.0.

This change simply wires up the same kwarg within the libvirt volume
classes for future use in scenarios where it is safe to force a
disconnect of a volume from a host, ignoring any failures to flush
caches etc.

Change-Id: Ia0666d5f53c4eb47ea865f9276bb8f457a95ac59

commit_message:
WIP nova-next: Deploy noVNC from source

This should help us identify issues such as bug #1822676 earlier before
the offending versions of noVNC are packaged.

This depends on I13c5638f320b18c4f6f945528352471d2bb31313 so that the
offending v1.1.0 version of noVNC is deployed by devstack when
NOVNC_FROM_PACKAGE=False.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/669647/
Change-Id: I04b306e975430cfe1d3d758827b27f650bacbce3
Related-Bug: #1822676

commit_message:
Remove useless proto parameter from sample functions

Some functions in unit tests are creating namedtuples that represent
loadbalancers, these sample loadbalancer objects contain a 'protocol'
field that doesn't exist in real objects and isn't used.

Change-Id: I8f191a720a3d38a7f579ed5f587563bfd40cce15

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
they are not needed during installation.

Change-Id: I94a87c4a7d0c2d5104e092d3b17ea42e0dd6bbaa

debug.
