revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-23 01:39:38.000000000', 'message': 'Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: Ib8c2242c76106ecb41c267fe75f8f824e2934cc1
Closes-Bug: #1904962
'}]
commit_message:
Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: Ib8c2242c76106ecb41c267fe75f8f824e2934cc1
Closes-Bug: #1904962

[{'created': '2020-06-10 06:01:11.000000000', 'message': 'Rewrite OpenStack on LXD page

This corrects inaccuracies, adds useful material,
improves the organisation, and uses a better
writing style.

A lot of bloat was removed: creation of multiple
images and flavors; multiple deploy commands;
ancient networking configuration commands that
are not used in other documentation (even though
Mitaka is still supported).

Change-Id: Ib924acb52b9d90c945815087ee1227007ce8123e

profiles in particular is better explained.

Page is more streamlined. Removed: creation of
multiple images and flavors; multiple deploy
commands; old networking configuration commands
that are not used in other documentation (even
though Mitaka is still supported). Python network
configuration scripts were replaced by native
openstack client commands.

Change-Id: Ib924acb52b9d90c945815087ee1227007ce8123e
'}]
commit_message:
Rewrite OpenStack on LXD page

This corrects inaccuracies, adds useful material,
and improves the organisation/writing. LXD
profiles in particular is better explained.

Page is more streamlined. Removed: creation of
multiple images and flavors; multiple deploy
commands; old networking configuration commands
that are not used in other documentation (even
though Mitaka is still supported). Python network
configuration scripts were replaced by native
openstack client commands.

Change-Id: Ib924acb52b9d90c945815087ee1227007ce8123e

commit_message:
Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: Icd6698d7b15344b7ab1c14aad08ebc1cd61346f6
Closes-Bug: #1904962

messages:

recheck

Different error at least this time...

Failed to download metadata for repo 'AppStream': Cannot download repomd.xml: Cannot download repodata/repomd.xml: All mirrors were tried"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-11-24 15:09:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Review-Priority+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-11-24 15:11:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2020-11-24 19:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-11-25 09:33:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-24 10:45:49.000000000', 'message': 'CI: add dummy1 port for seed upgrade and VM jobs

For some reason this configuration was omitted or incomplete in these
jobs. Without this configuration, Kayobe development configuration adds
eth1 to the breth1 bridge if it exists, or leaves the bridge without a
port otherwise. This can lead to network connectivity issues, if the IP
address of eth1 becomes inaccessible when it is added to breth1.

This change fixes the issue by ensuring that the dummy1 interface
exists, and configuring the aio network to add it to breth1 as a port,
instead of eth1.

Change-Id: I47115e5d8d1fb448cb9e46dc43b56c64987e428b
'}]
commit_message:
CI: add dummy1 port for seed upgrade and VM jobs

For some reason this configuration was omitted or incomplete in these
jobs. Without this configuration, Kayobe development configuration adds
eth1 to the breth1 bridge if it exists, or leaves the bridge without a
port otherwise. This can lead to network connectivity issues, if the IP
address of eth1 becomes inaccessible when it is added to breth1.

This change fixes the issue by ensuring that the dummy1 interface
exists, and configuring the aio network to add it to breth1 as a port,
instead of eth1.

Change-Id: I47115e5d8d1fb448cb9e46dc43b56c64987e428b

messages: [{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-11-04 10:10:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2020-11-05 13:11:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-11-24 16:14:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-04 10:10:01.000000000', 'message': 'Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is deprecated and TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is
the new environment variable name that replaces it [1].

This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/

Change-Id: I814b6c6507116d91f4df6fa5911aab8a1b2f3911
'}]
commit_message:
Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is deprecated and TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is
the new environment variable name that replaces it [1].

This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/

Change-Id: I814b6c6507116d91f4df6fa5911aab8a1b2f3911

commit_message:
Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: If98c83c16e981353780573f6f0f0f737f1374ba1
Closes-Bug: #1904962

commit_message:
Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: Ib6757e9145d1b0dc3cead9b24637019a93576c61
Closes-Bug: #1904962

commit_message:
Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: I7437211ed249a552da7c9cbf1707ee929163c844
Closes-Bug: #1904962

commit_message:
Build containers for single consumer job

Make standalone job build containers when there is one single
consumer job in layout. Do not run content provider jobs in
this case.

Change-Id: I8f4bb37091fbe3b12ebc86758fd7584505270a7d
(cherry picked from commit efc95ebf4ae930663d7e49c57b8ee5b4fca994bf)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-19 02:36:49.000000000', 'message': "Make sure networks_skip_config defaults to []

The ansible network configs does a check if network
is in networks_skip_config. When networks_skip_config is
not defined in the role data it get's defined as 'null'
in the Ansible inventory.

Default it to an empty list when creating the GroupVars
so that it's always of type: List in the inventory.

Change-Id: I0c09118b947aeee9b011e7d0ec23ab99af3680af
Closes-Bug: #1904808
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure networks_skip_config defaults to []

The ansible network configs does a check if network
is in networks_skip_config. When networks_skip_config is
not defined in the role data it get's defined as 'null'
in the Ansible inventory.

Default it to an empty list when creating the GroupVars
so that it's always of type: List in the inventory.

Change-Id: I0c09118b947aeee9b011e7d0ec23ab99af3680af
Closes-Bug: #1904808

commit_message:
[Container build] raise Exception post logging error

Currently it catches SystemError and log error message
but do not fail, raise SystemError so it fails too.

Closes-Bug: #1905348
Change-Id: I2e823c58779dba529a58aff5e0e1c0c880c267aa

commit_message:
Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: Ia82e1a8587f2056bfeece341c5463b0aacb222f3
Closes-Bug: #1904962

commit_message:
Use _evacuate_server helper in func test

We have a nice helper for calling evacuate and waiting for the result so
let's replace the direct post api calls in func test with the helper.

Change-Id: I87a10e6ad65ae493cd34c6c0e62d60c5d6f9d1d8

commit_message:
Allow db sync timeouts to be configurable

As Openstack projects continue to have longer database migration
chains, the Puppet default timeout of 300 seconds for an execution
is becoming too short a duration on some hardware, leading to timeouts.
As projects continue to add more migration scripts without pruning
the base, timeouts will continue to become more frequent unless
this time can be expanded.

Change-Id: Ic4494c93ebb0449d16d5db6f780b3971a17b038a
Closes-Bug: #1904962

commit_message:
Adopt grenade to multinode setting

* Change parent for grenade-heat-multinode job to grenade-multinode
* Use HOST_TOPOLOGY to specify multinode.
* Add irrelevant-files

Change-Id: I2abdf09bcd65441006f5315321e016e02704d6f1

commit_message:
Add support to Endpoints without targetRef

The targetRef field is optional for the Endpoints object,
and when service without selectors are created that field
is more likely to not be specified. This commit ensures
Kuryr properly wires Endpoints without targetRef.

Change-Id: Ib43e88aafd9e0907556a0e740990a6acbd173fb0

commit_message:
Reuse the docs deps to benefit from constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building docs,
which may not be supported by stable and lower branches,
so should be restricted by respective version's upper-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I1e134bb72b6fef3fba8f20d3b3d65520c66bbbf1

commit_message:
doc: Drop old Django information

The dropped information is about Ussuri release which dropped
Django 1.11 support. The information is no longer needed
as we are in Wallaby release.

Note that the referred bug is about a typo in the dropped note.
Closes-Bug: #1904855

Change-Id: Iee2b5a7f2c0d2a4e68db638d7f17e99884df42de

[{'created': '2020-11-11 18:19:13.000000000', 'message': '[cinder] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Icea2a40089bcd187fcc81ec6a470eae1bb981753

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this

Change-Id: Icea2a40089bcd187fcc81ec6a470eae1bb981753

commit_message:
[cinder] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Icea2a40089bcd187fcc81ec6a470eae1bb981753

this is great!  seems to be the only test that covers the new branch:

	@@ -423,9 +423,6 @@ class Receiver(object):
		 of place partition, for example.
		 """
		 line = self._readline('updates start')
	-        if not line:
	-            # Guess they hung up waiting for us to process the missing check

		 if line.strip() != b':UPDATES: START':
		     raise Exception('Looking for :UPDATES: START got %r' % line[:1024])
		 successes = 0'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2020-11-25 09:48:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

commit_message:
Release glance-store for wallaby-1 milestone

This is a library release for glance-store for the wallaby-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

Change-Id: I21dd27f6f917f89f38a38cacd502ede5c1adba40

subject: Import HTTPStatus instead of http_client
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-25 08:33:31.000000000', 'message': 'Import HTTPStatus instead of http_client

python introduced http.HTTPStatus since version 3.5,
and the OpenStack Victoria has targeted a minimum
version of python 3.6[1], cyborg also does that.

To keep update with the latest version we introduce HTTPStatus to replace http_client in cyborg code.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html

Change-Id: I4abecc96705573b27d651cab885d1416a39dabdb
'}]
commit_message:
Import HTTPStatus instead of http_client

python introduced http.HTTPStatus since version 3.5,
and the OpenStack Victoria has targeted a minimum
version of python 3.6[1], cyborg also does that.

To keep update with the latest version we introduce HTTPStatus to replace http_client in cyborg code.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html

Change-Id: I4abecc96705573b27d651cab885d1416a39dabdb

[{'created': '2020-11-24 15:37:50.000000000', 'message': "CI: Fix ansible-lint failure

Currently ansible-lint is failing with:

    KeyError: 'hostvars'

This change fixes the issue by making the hostvars key optional. This
should not affect real usage, since an error is raised in this case.

Change-Id: I6dd482e95fa4f5508452d83bb64613d55eb1985f
"}]
commit_message:
CI: Fix ansible-lint failure

Currently ansible-lint is failing with:

    KeyError: 'hostvars'

This change fixes the issue by making the hostvars key optional. This
should not affect real usage, since an error is raised in this case.

Change-Id: I6dd482e95fa4f5508452d83bb64613d55eb1985f

> recheck
 >

That's a nice idea, I will be interested in the design of that. I'm not very familiar with the architecture if Ironic internals but I was surprised that conductors were handing off tasks like this, rather than having the conductor "in charge" of the node having sole control.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-05 18:28:04.000000000', 'message': 'Always retry locking when performing task handoff

There are some Ironic execution workflows where there is not an easy way
to retry, such as when attempting to hand off the processing of an async
task to a conductor. Task handoff can require releasing a lock on the
node, so the next entity processing the task can acquire the lock
itself. However, this is vulnerable to race conditions, as there is no
uniform retry mechanism built in to such handoffs. Consider the
continue_node_deploy/clean logic, which does this:

  method = 'continue_node_%s' % operation
  # Need to release the lock to let the conductor take it
  task.release_resources()
  getattr(rpc, method)(task.context, uuid, topic=topic

If another process obtains a lock between the releasing of resources and
the acquiring of the lock during the continue_node_* operation, and
holds the lock longer than the max attempt * interval window (which
defaults to 3 seconds), then the handoff will never complete. Beyond
that, because there is no proper queue for processes waiting on the
lock, there is no fairness, so it's also possible that instead of one
long lock being held, the lock is obtained and held for a short window
several times by other competing processes.

This manifests as nodes occasionally getting stuck in the "DEPLOYING"
state during a deploy. For example, a user may attempt to open or access
the serial console before the deploy is complete--the serial console
process obtains a lock and starves the conductor of the lock, so the
conductor cannot finish the deploy. It's also possible a long heartbeat
or badly-timed sequence of heartbeats could do the same.

To fix this, this commit introduces the concept of a "patient" lock,
which will retry indefinitely until it doesn't encounter the NodeLocked
exception. This overrides any retry behavior.

  .. note::
     There may be other cases where such a lock is desired.

Story: #2008323
Change-Id: I9937fab18a50111ec56a3fd023cdb9d510a1e990

If another process obtains a lock between the releasing of resources and

This manifests as nodes occasionally getting stuck in the "DEPLOYING"

To fix this, this commit introduces the concept of a "patient" lock,
which will retry indefinitely until it doesn't encounter the NodeLocked

  .. note::

'}, {'created': '2020-11-09 22:01:37.000000000', 'message': 'Always retry locking when performing task handoff

There are some Ironic execution workflows where there is not an easy way
to retry, such as when attempting to hand off the processing of an async
task to a conductor. Task handoff can require releasing a lock on the
node, so the next entity processing the task can acquire the lock
itself. However, this is vulnerable to race conditions, as there is no
uniform retry mechanism built in to such handoffs. Consider the
continue_node_deploy/clean logic, which does this:

  method = 'continue_node_%s' % operation
  # Need to release the lock to let the conductor take it
  task.release_resources()
  getattr(rpc, method)(task.context, uuid, topic=topic

If another process obtains a lock between the releasing of resources and
the acquiring of the lock during the continue_node_* operation, and
holds the lock longer than the max attempt * interval window (which
defaults to 3 seconds), then the handoff will never complete. Beyond
that, because there is no proper queue for processes waiting on the
lock, there is no fairness, so it's also possible that instead of one
long lock being held, the lock is obtained and held for a short window
several times by other competing processes.

This manifests as nodes occasionally getting stuck in the "DEPLOYING"
state during a deploy. For example, a user may attempt to open or access
the serial console before the deploy is complete--the serial console
process obtains a lock and starves the conductor of the lock, so the
conductor cannot finish the deploy. It's also possible a long heartbeat
or badly-timed sequence of heartbeats could do the same.

To fix this, this commit introduces the concept of a "patient" lock,
which will retry indefinitely until it doesn't encounter the NodeLocked
exception. This overrides any retry behavior.

  .. note::
     There may be other cases where such a lock is desired.

Story: #2008323
Change-Id: I9937fab18a50111ec56a3fd023cdb9d510a1e990
'}, {'created': '2020-11-09 23:48:26.000000000', 'message': 'Always retry locking when performing task handoff

There are some Ironic execution workflows where there is not an easy way
to retry, such as when attempting to hand off the processing of an async
task to a conductor. Task handoff can require releasing a lock on the
node, so the next entity processing the task can acquire the lock
itself. However, this is vulnerable to race conditions, as there is no
uniform retry mechanism built in to such handoffs. Consider the
continue_node_deploy/clean logic, which does this:

  method = 'continue_node_%s' % operation
  # Need to release the lock to let the conductor take it
  task.release_resources()
  getattr(rpc, method)(task.context, uuid, topic=topic

If another process obtains a lock between the releasing of resources and
the acquiring of the lock during the continue_node_* operation, and
holds the lock longer than the max attempt * interval window (which
defaults to 3 seconds), then the handoff will never complete. Beyond
that, because there is no proper queue for processes waiting on the
lock, there is no fairness, so it's also possible that instead of one
long lock being held, the lock is obtained and held for a short window
several times by other competing processes.

This manifests as nodes occasionally getting stuck in the "DEPLOYING"
state during a deploy. For example, a user may attempt to open or access
the serial console before the deploy is complete--the serial console
process obtains a lock and starves the conductor of the lock, so the
conductor cannot finish the deploy. It's also possible a long heartbeat
or badly-timed sequence of heartbeats could do the same.

To fix this, this commit introduces the concept of a "patient" lock,
which will retry indefinitely until it doesn't encounter the NodeLocked
exception. This overrides any retry behavior.

  .. note::
     There may be other cases where such a lock is desired.

Story: #2008323
Change-Id: I9937fab18a50111ec56a3fd023cdb9d510a1e990

commit_message:
Always retry locking when performing task handoff

There are some Ironic execution workflows where there is not an easy way
to retry, such as when attempting to hand off the processing of an async
task to a conductor. Task handoff can require releasing a lock on the
node, so the next entity processing the task can acquire the lock
itself. However, this is vulnerable to race conditions, as there is no
uniform retry mechanism built in to such handoffs. Consider the
continue_node_deploy/clean logic, which does this:

  method = 'continue_node_%s' % operation
  # Need to release the lock to let the conductor take it
  task.release_resources()
  getattr(rpc, method)(task.context, uuid, topic=topic

If another process obtains a lock between the releasing of resources and
the acquiring of the lock during the continue_node_* operation, and
holds the lock longer than the max attempt * interval window (which
defaults to 3 seconds), then the handoff will never complete. Beyond
that, because there is no proper queue for processes waiting on the
lock, there is no fairness, so it's also possible that instead of one
long lock being held, the lock is obtained and held for a short window
several times by other competing processes.

This manifests as nodes occasionally getting stuck in the "DEPLOYING"
state during a deploy. For example, a user may attempt to open or access
the serial console before the deploy is complete--the serial console
process obtains a lock and starves the conductor of the lock, so the
conductor cannot finish the deploy. It's also possible a long heartbeat
or badly-timed sequence of heartbeats could do the same.

To fix this, this commit introduces the concept of a "patient" lock,
which will retry indefinitely until it doesn't encounter the NodeLocked
exception. This overrides any retry behavior.

  .. note::
     There may be other cases where such a lock is desired.

Story: #2008323
Change-Id: I9937fab18a50111ec56a3fd023cdb9d510a1e990

commit_message:
[kolla] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Ifbe2f7a4fac0d7c5b193737a19479a924166f9b3

commit_message:
Use registry at quay.io instead of docker.io.

Lately, Docker.io started to limit their resources[1], so it started to
be annoying in a cases of usual development, to typical test by CI
systems. Although our image is tiny, but still, we can observe that
limits were hit. Let's move on to the quay.io.

[1] https://www.docker.com/increase-rate-limit

Change-Id: I32af39344cb3e590a13bd07b64227d8acab6ccd0

commit_message:
Revert "Skip Trilio dirs when setting ownership in /var/lib/nova"

This reverts commit 63c522eb31d88933b8ccc6ccb08c4e7492e47ae9.

Reason for revert: Patch caused bug #1903033,also patches are currently
not being tested in CI in CentOS7 jobs thus breaking changes are being
merged, [1] should fix it. This can be re reverted or abandoned once fix for the issue is available.
Also testing if with [1] patches are also being included or not.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/763712

Related-Bug: #1903033
Change-Id: I56c8fb1393ff1f38edb4077b1d3264f729893052
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/763712
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/763747

subject: Support volume safe delete
messages:
[{'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2020-10-15 09:26:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2020-10-15 09:32:07.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bp/volume-safe-delete'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-10-15 09:43:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is actually a security bug for any backend driver that does not automatically take care of this. This should not be an extra step someone needs to know to take.'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2020-10-15 11:20:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

hi, Sean McGinnis, thanks for your review.
just because any backend driver that does not automatically take care of this, so we added this feature to the cloud platform side, allowing users to implement it through the cloud platform without having to rely on back-end storage.
i think as an end user, he need this, if the data in the volume is very sensitive.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2020-11-05 10:59:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

This was discussed during the Wallaby PTG [1] and our documentation is being improved to explain the security aspects of this feature.

If you feel that this should still be addressed or have questions/concerns please add it to the next IRC meeting agenda [3] and come to the meeting to let us know.

Info on the Cinder IRC meetings can be found at https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CinderMeetings

[1]: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CinderWallabyPTGSummary#Two_proposed_specs_on_the_same_topic_.28mutually_assured_destruction.29
[2]: https://review.opendev.org/761535 
[3]: https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/cinder-wallaby-meetings'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2020-11-25 08:35:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Skip test_create_object_with_transfer_encoding

test_create_object_with_transfer_encoding is failing
consistently since 20th Nov and blocking Cinder and
Swift gate.

- https://zuul.openstack.org/builds?job_name=tempest-integrated-storage

Let's skip this test until we find the fix.

Related-Bug: #1905432

Change-Id: I63c500920875c08ce7aba788742a04b9b3653daf

commit_message:
Bump minimum version of oslo.policy to 2.1.0

The changes following this one require `scope_types` which was added
in oslo.policy-1.32.0. Since version oslo.policy-1.30.0 was released
in late 2017 we should bump to at least oslo.policy-2.1.0 which was
released in late January 2019 bringing us a little closer to the
present time.

Change-Id: I02a2c42c0e1fceebbe6c81f8d674f62f90ee1670
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Remove adding allocation pool to existing allocation pool.

updating subnet info should take care of allocation pools too,
this will cause conflict exception and is against the descriptive
nature of ansible, thus there is no need toadding new pool to
the existing pool.

Task: 41307
Story: 2008384
Change-Id: I9983216e3b9abf69c8642ea4fc65c6d1e325fd13

subject: [Ussuri Only] Ignore read-only "self" propery of images
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-11-24 12:19:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-11-24 15:17:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2020-11-25 03:01:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-24 12:19:32.000000000', 'message': '[Ussuri Only] Ignore read-only "self" propery of images

This change makes sure that the "self" property is ignored when
managing glance images, because the propery is read-only and not
supposed to be updated.

This issue was introduced by the switch to openstacksdk which was done
in openstackclient during Ussuri cycle so this doesn't affect Train
and older releases. In addition uring the following patch was merged in
openstacksdk during Victoria cycle and "openstack image show" no longer
includes the self propery in image properties since Victoria. So this
change is submitted only for Ussuri.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/726626

Change-Id: Ie43ffe5075fac12be6dcae2771f9acde3cc16063
Closes-Bug: #1905404
'}]
commit_message:
[Ussuri Only] Ignore read-only "self" propery of images

This change makes sure that the "self" property is ignored when
managing glance images, because the propery is read-only and not
supposed to be updated.

This issue was introduced by the switch to openstacksdk which was done
in openstackclient during Ussuri cycle so this doesn't affect Train
and older releases. In addition uring the following patch was merged in
openstacksdk during Victoria cycle and "openstack image show" no longer
includes the self propery in image properties since Victoria. So this
change is submitted only for Ussuri.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/726626

Change-Id: Ie43ffe5075fac12be6dcae2771f9acde3cc16063
Closes-Bug: #1905404

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-30 03:05:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I2155491aa65b11c36e0f2f7f0b53b405fb2b387a
'}, {'created': '2020-11-20 01:38:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8

avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I2155491aa65b11c36e0f2f7f0b53b405fb2b387a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I2155491aa65b11c36e0f2f7f0b53b405fb2b387a

commit_message:
Add missing dependencies about keystone_puppet_config

The keystone_puppet_config should be generated during configuration
phase, otherwise some resources which requires access to Keystone
api fails.

Change-Id: Iba6b8b16a2aa5e9a8ebbcc297f659767a5ce64af
(cherry picked from commit 92101bda25d4ff0c45e49209836acdac381e5945)

commit_message:
Make sure apache metadata is set for nova-metadata service

In case of cellv2 multicell environment nova-metadata is the only
httpd managed service on the cell controller role. In case of
tls-everywhere it is required that the cell controller host has
ther needed metadata to be able to request the HTTP certificates.
Otherwise the getcert request fails with "Insufficient 'add' privilege
to add the entry 'krbprincipalname=HTTP/cell1-cellcontrol-0....'"

Change-Id: I57a49d1b7fc4c03b773f3a52b327584f537aca19
(cherry picked from commit 89d605103c62f0a94944d5c9683c97a9156ef213)

commit_message:
libvirt: update live migration defaults

This change enables force-completion as the new default for the live
migration completion action and recommend the use
of post-copy and autoconverge by default but does not enable them.

Change-Id: I083ce27a9bf76353f713d165e1745249cdcafa07

commit_message:
Use safe version of hacking

Versions of hacking from 3.1.0 until 4.0.0, NOT inclusive, are supposed
to require a safe version of flake8, so besides normal issues related
to minor version upgrades, we can safely use those versions.
Also, forcing pycodestyle versions to be compatible with flake8 installed
by hacking.

Also, listing all dependencies in lower-constraints, including
dependencies from other libraries and projects.

Change-Id: I8eca30c2b04c2298e09482b2f04f0b43267f67ca

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-24 19:29:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix oslopolicy-j2y-convertor tool for RuleDefault

Description and operators are mandatory parameter for
DocumentedRuleDefault but few services still using the
RuleDefault for exmaple glance
- https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/1344c45772c1a77107f621632642cf1488e431db/glance/policies/image.py#L16

To make work on oslopolicy-j2y-convertor tool to covert
the JSON file for such services we need to pass description
in preparing DocumentedRuleDefault for this tool to generate
the yaml file with rule description. For such cases, it add
rule name as description.

Also for 'operations', do not write it in generate file
for RuleDefault as that end up with blank space.

Change-Id: I910291a152402051b1eac96c3ec16c3f0bb8bbb7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix oslopolicy-j2y-convertor tool for RuleDefault

Description and operators are mandatory parameter for
DocumentedRuleDefault but few services still using the
RuleDefault for exmaple glance
- https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/1344c45772c1a77107f621632642cf1488e431db/glance/policies/image.py#L16

To make work on oslopolicy-j2y-convertor tool to covert
the JSON file for such services we need to pass description
in preparing DocumentedRuleDefault for this tool to generate
the yaml file with rule description. For such cases, it add
rule name as description.

Also for 'operations', do not write it in generate file
for RuleDefault as that end up with blank space.

Change-Id: I910291a152402051b1eac96c3ec16c3f0bb8bbb7

@Shi

I think Tobias intended to point out missing cherry pick line for V.
When we backport patches to older branches, we prefer backporting the fix not directly from master, but from the next stable branches like V -> U -> T, because it generally helps us maintain backport status easily.
I'd suggest you backport patches from Victoria, not directly from master."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-11-09 14:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26721, 'date': '2020-11-10 09:17:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> @Shi
 > 
 > I think Tobias intended to point out missing cherry pick line for
 > V.
 > When we backport patches to older branches, we prefer backporting
 > the fix not directly from master, but from the next stable branches
 > like V -> U -> T, because it generally helps us maintain backport
 > status easily.

'}]
commit_message:
Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is deprecated and TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is
the new environment variable name that replaces it [1].

This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/

Change-Id: I80ad7c4fe18bb515bad33ad69e36402647e6ae9e

commit_message:
Use name_lower for network resource name

Fixes an issue in the tripleo_composable_network module.
It need to set the name of networks to the 'name_lower'
value, not the 'name' value to keep naming convention
compatible with tripleo-heat-templates.

Change-Id: Iec06cf575d3cc45569dd761b49ade452b40a01b5

commit_message:
Get overcloud domain name from ctlplane

The ctlplane networks dns_domain is 'ctlplane.' + overcloud_domain_name
from undercloud.conf. Since overcloud_domain_name should match THT parameter
CloudDomain we can use this to resolve the proper domain name in case
the user did'nt provide a name in network data input.

Change-Id: Ia64d68f0f629f0dc708c3dd59c305425627be7be

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-16 16:57:40.000000000', 'message': 'New option to trigger paunch configuration on only one container.

Adding the name option enable one to create playbook like this:

    - hosts: Compute
      gather_facts: true
      become: true
      tasks:
        - name: update one container
          paunch:
            config: "/var/lib/tripleo-config/container-startup-config/step_4"
            config_id:
             - 'tripleo_step4'
            name: ovn_controller
            action: apply
            container_cli: podman
            managed_by: tripleo-Compute
            config_overrides:
              image: undercloud-0.ctlplane.redhat.local:8787/openstack-ovn-controller:16.1_20201020.1_hotfix
            cleanup: True

In this example we deliver an specific change to all Compute node
without running the entire update process.

This file has been deleted after ussuri so this is an ussuri/train
only patch.

Change-Id: I70ccfad3ea96dff44641bf70d459adb7cccb21d5
'}, {'created': '2020-11-17 16:29:59.000000000', 'message': 'New option to trigger paunch configuration on only one container.

Adding the container_name option enables one to create playbook like
this:

    - hosts: Compute
      gather_facts: true
      become: true
      tasks:
        - name: update one container
          paunch:
            config: "/var/lib/tripleo-config/container-startup-config/step_4"
            config_id:
             - 'tripleo_step4'
            container_name: ovn_controller
            action: apply
            container_cli: podman
            managed_by: tripleo-Compute
            config_overrides:
              image: undercloud-0.ctlplane.redhat.local:8787/openstack-ovn-controller:16.1_20201020.1_hotfix
            cleanup: True

In this example we deliver an specific change to all Compute node
without running the entire update process.

This is only syntaxic sugar as running with:

    config: "/var/lib/tripleo-config/container-startup-config/step_4/hashed-ovn_controller.json"

has the same effect.

Note that config_overrides doesn't have the same semantic when we use
the container_name option as we don't require the user to pass the
full structure where it should be (still in the context of offering
some more convenience to the user):

   { <container_name>: {<changed_key>: <change>, ...} }

Here we prepend the container_name to the structure so that the user
focus on the container parameter.

This file has been deleted after ussuri so this patch starts at
ussuri.

Change-Id: I70ccfad3ea96dff44641bf70d459adb7cccb21d5
'}]
commit_message:
New option to trigger paunch configuration on only one container.

Adding the container_name option enables one to create playbook like
this:

    - hosts: Compute
      gather_facts: true
      become: true
      tasks:
        - name: update one container
          paunch:
            config: "/var/lib/tripleo-config/container-startup-config/step_4"
            config_id:
             - 'tripleo_step4'
            container_name: ovn_controller
            action: apply
            container_cli: podman
            managed_by: tripleo-Compute
            config_overrides:
              image: undercloud-0.ctlplane.redhat.local:8787/openstack-ovn-controller:16.1_20201020.1_hotfix
            cleanup: True

In this example we deliver an specific change to all Compute node
without running the entire update process.

This is only syntaxic sugar as running with:

    config: "/var/lib/tripleo-config/container-startup-config/step_4/hashed-ovn_controller.json"

has the same effect.

Note that config_overrides doesn't have the same semantic when we use
the container_name option as we don't require the user to pass the
full structure where it should be (still in the context of offering
some more convenience to the user):

   { <container_name>: {<changed_key>: <change>, ...} }

Here we prepend the container_name to the structure so that the user
focus on the container parameter.

This file has been deleted after ussuri so this patch starts at
ussuri.

Change-Id: I70ccfad3ea96dff44641bf70d459adb7cccb21d5

commit_message:
Update RDO to use Victoria release

Seems like we were still using Ussuri's RDO to get openvswitch package and now
that it broke it's an issue. This commit updates that to use Victoria RDO
release.

Also Dockerfiles are updated to use Victoria's upper-constraints.txt.

Change-Id: I272ee354c70e786686a617f71acb7a12b76cfad6

commit_message:
Fix conditionals/types in check_flavors and verify_profiles

Existing resources "DISK_GB", "MEMORY_MB", "VCPU" were not considered to
be available in case of custom_resource_class_val == False, also use correct
types for resource comparison and required_count calculation.

Change-Id: Ia194cebaeb7dcc40b4011e50cdde7648b4bf87b1
Closes-Bug: #1905018
(cherry picked from commit 3221727a8d56d9edb8f6b3dd4cdfb0094b49f757)

Change-Id: Ib67b6bd69ed1c3f9fcd32552b6599cbe4ff478ce
Closes-Bug: #1904917
"}, {'created': '2020-11-19 20:49:22.000000000', 'message': "Ansible-runner is failing when passing host to display

failing when actually set to a non-string. Check to make sure host is a

Change-Id: Ib67b6bd69ed1c3f9fcd32552b6599cbe4ff478ce
Closes-Bug: #1904917
"}, {'created': '2020-11-19 21:06:51.000000000', 'message': "Ansible-runner is failing when passing host to display

string or just unset it if it isn't a string value.

Change-Id: Ib67b6bd69ed1c3f9fcd32552b6599cbe4ff478ce
Closes-Bug: #1904917
"}]
commit_message:
Ansible-runner is failing when passing host to display

Ansible-runner is using their own custom call back and it appears to be
failing when actually set to a non-string. Check to make sure host is a
string or just unset it if it isn't a string value.

Change-Id: Ib67b6bd69ed1c3f9fcd32552b6599cbe4ff478ce
Closes-Bug: #1904917

commit_message:
Adding test_trunk_subport_lifecycle to skiplist

This test is intermittenly failing in ci because neutron wasn't able
to set the status up because port was not bound.
Issue is still being investigated, but for now added in train skip
list.

Change-Id: Iff787e3584c6a72e8cda86a366b50f0729cc1120
Related-Bug: #1871818

commit_message:
Add agent/explicitly_egress_direct support

This configuration parameter for the ML2/OVS agent was added in
I14fefe289a19b718b247bf0740ca9bc47f8903f4 and backported up to
stable/queens, preventing flooding on integration bridge in some cases.

It needs to be enabled on specific node types, so add option to
configure it.

Conflicts:
	manifests/agents/ml2/ovs.pp
	spec/classes/neutron_agents_ml2_ovs_spec.rb

Related-Bug: #1732067
Change-Id: Iff50d2d086c687ef9ec1ba878e24c06dfc8a7d99
(cherry picked from commit d0bc82d8427c43dac07a8118d2fe35ba5a9d9dce)

commit_message:
Fix signature_verified not matched

1. When enable image cache, and verify_glance_signatures is set
   enabled, the second boot volume will miss signature_verified
   in volume_glance_metadata.
2. When re-schedule after creating failure(occurs after set
   signature_verified already), operation will be terminated
   because of GlanceMetadataExists exception.
This patch fix these.

Closes-Bug: #1826383
Closes-Bug: #1826384
Closes-Bug: #1823445

Change-Id: I748fb0340ec4123f58456506d2c6f18857e7a51f

commit_message:
Add user configurable SSH arguments to extend defaults

This change will extend the SSHD configuration options by providing a user
facing interface which extends our defaults. Users will be able to provide
an extra-var that will combine with our defaults.

* User provided defaults will take precidence in the event of a collision.

Change-Id: I68e797d81b2c774c87b73b202158f1c89a384b18
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Unset memcached_servers by default

This change make sure that OIDCMemCacheServers is not set when
the memcached_servers is not set, to avoid setting empty value.

Change-Id: Id9dfbab25b7a064e5fee6d8bf4fe6a171fba9b15

Fix regex for meta directories

There are other files like os_tripleo_baremetal_node_introspection.py,
that contains "meta" in the name that makes zuul skip jobs.

configuration.

commit_message:
swift: fix group membership in debuntu/binary

The UCA packages seem to be removing the swift user from the kolla
group. Explicitly add it after installation.

Closes-Bug: #1905279

Change-Id: I51c7c6e2f520a582de0409025eb5d1a6da2952a2

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be

fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes

[{'created': '2020-09-30 09:26:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix stop containers task in Swift rolling restart

When applying upgrade action on Swift, rolling restart was not
stopping containers on the right hosts if all Swift containers
were not deployed on the same host.

This patch proposes to use the same kind of detection already
done in reconfigure and associate a container to a group.

Change-Id: I75e31554228350ff2e1c2f53ff864f8649c8d618
Signed-off-by: Benjamin FÜHRMANN <benjamin.fuhrmann@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-10-10 18:11:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix stop containers task in Swift rolling restart

When applying upgrade action on Swift, rolling restart was not
stopping containers on the right hosts if all Swift containers
were not deployed on the same host.

This patch proposes to use the same kind of detection already
done in reconfigure and associate a container to a group.

Closes-Bug: 1899280
Change-Id: I75e31554228350ff2e1c2f53ff864f8649c8d618
Signed-off-by: Benjamin FÜHRMANN <benjamin.fuhrmann@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix stop containers task in Swift rolling restart

When applying upgrade action on Swift, rolling restart was not
stopping containers on the right hosts if all Swift containers
were not deployed on the same host.

This patch proposes to use the same kind of detection already
done in reconfigure and associate a container to a group.

Closes-Bug: 1899280
Change-Id: I75e31554228350ff2e1c2f53ff864f8649c8d618
Signed-off-by: Benjamin FÜHRMANN <benjamin.fuhrmann@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-19 11:19:49.000000000', 'message': 'Force MySQL / MariaDB log_warnings to 1

This MySQL / MariaDB server value was changed
from the value 1 to 2 between MariaDB 10.1 and 10.2 [1].  The
result of this change is that any database connection which is
not gracefully closed results in a log message
"Got an error reading communication packets" in the MySQL server
log, which is misleading as it does not usually refer to any
actionable issue; real connectivity issues are always seen in
application logs and most of these messages in the server
logs are likely to be false positives due to the behavior of HAProxy.

While applications can reduce the occurence of this error by
ensuring that database connections are gracefully closed, this
is already the behavior of oslo.db and SQLAlchemy which maintains
a connection pool that closes out stale connections explicitly
when requests are made.

The majority of these warnings are likely the result of normal HAProxy
operation, where the settings "timeout client" and "timeout server"
are set to 90 minutes, such that any connection older than this
time will be non-gracefully closed by the proxy, generating
the warning.  An idle application server process will not have attended
to connections that are older than the timeout period,
leading to these connections being left for HAProxy to handle;
HAProxy's timeout behavior leading to this message in the logs has been
confirmed in local experimentation.

The application server itself is never exposed to this as upon
the start of work will always recycle any connection that is older
than its own timeout, which defaults to 60 minutes for applications
using oslo.config + oslo.db.   Without HAProxy having the capability
to close out these connections using MySQL's protocol, the messages
are unavoidable.

The message will also occur anytime an Openstack process is stopped
or killed for all connections that are pooled in that process.

The correct way to diagnose if an application is having connectivity
issues is to look in the application server log itself for error
messages and stack traces that have much more detail as to the context
that produced a particular error message.   This warning is also
known to occur when an application server is not able to respond
to packets quickly enough as has been observed with services
such as Cinder where eventlet monkeypatching causes the PyMySQL
client to be blocked; however when this occurs, there is an
informative stack trace and error message in the application logs
that shows what's going on.

As this particular warning message is not useful in that most
occurences will refer to normal behavior as designed, the
log level should be forced to "1" to prevent these messages
as they are causing confusion in downstream environments.

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/upgrading-from-mariadb-101-to-mariadb-102/#incompatible-changes-between-101-and-102

Change-Id: I0efb4f77aaceda635c8983d6b7a240171a7accdc
'}]
commit_message:
Force MySQL / MariaDB log_warnings to 1

This MySQL / MariaDB server value was changed
from the value 1 to 2 between MariaDB 10.1 and 10.2 [1].  The
result of this change is that any database connection which is
not gracefully closed results in a log message
"Got an error reading communication packets" in the MySQL server
log, which is misleading as it does not usually refer to any
actionable issue; real connectivity issues are always seen in
application logs and most of these messages in the server
logs are likely to be false positives due to the behavior of HAProxy.

While applications can reduce the occurence of this error by
ensuring that database connections are gracefully closed, this
is already the behavior of oslo.db and SQLAlchemy which maintains
a connection pool that closes out stale connections explicitly
when requests are made.

The majority of these warnings are likely the result of normal HAProxy
operation, where the settings "timeout client" and "timeout server"
are set to 90 minutes, such that any connection older than this
time will be non-gracefully closed by the proxy, generating
the warning.  An idle application server process will not have attended
to connections that are older than the timeout period,
leading to these connections being left for HAProxy to handle;
HAProxy's timeout behavior leading to this message in the logs has been
confirmed in local experimentation.

The application server itself is never exposed to this as upon
the start of work will always recycle any connection that is older
than its own timeout, which defaults to 60 minutes for applications
using oslo.config + oslo.db.   Without HAProxy having the capability
to close out these connections using MySQL's protocol, the messages
are unavoidable.

The message will also occur anytime an Openstack process is stopped
or killed for all connections that are pooled in that process.

The correct way to diagnose if an application is having connectivity
issues is to look in the application server log itself for error
messages and stack traces that have much more detail as to the context
that produced a particular error message.   This warning is also
known to occur when an application server is not able to respond
to packets quickly enough as has been observed with services
such as Cinder where eventlet monkeypatching causes the PyMySQL
client to be blocked; however when this occurs, there is an
informative stack trace and error message in the application logs
that shows what's going on.

As this particular warning message is not useful in that most
occurences will refer to normal behavior as designed, the
log level should be forced to "1" to prevent these messages
as they are causing confusion in downstream environments.

[1] https://mariadb.com/kb/en/upgrading-from-mariadb-101-to-mariadb-102/#incompatible-changes-between-101-and-102

Change-Id: I0efb4f77aaceda635c8983d6b7a240171a7accdc

[CEPH-POOL] Read the quota per pool from pool spec

This is to read pool quota from pool ssec so that each pool
can have own quota.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-20 00:32:37.000000000', 'message': "Add common checks for json to yaml policy file migration

As part of community goal[1] for migrating the policy file
from JSON format to YAML we need to add upgrade check to
detect any JSON formatted file. That check needs to be
done in each service side which are deprecating the JSON
format. So to avoid uplicate code, this commit add that
check in oslo_upgradechecks and that can be enabled from
service side during they migrate to YAML format.

Service will enable it like below:

    _upgrade_checks = (
        (_('Policy File JSON to YAML Migration'),
            (common_checks.check_policy_json, {'conf': CONF})),
    )

Also modify the check() method to accept the **kwargs for checks.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: Ifa71c20879c964f794a40b981744d95db4ab1602

commit_message:
Add common checks for json to yaml policy file migration

As part of community goal[1] for migrating the policy file
from JSON format to YAML we need to add upgrade check to
detect any JSON formatted file. That check needs to be
done in each service side which are deprecating the JSON
format. So to avoid duplicate code, this commit add that
check in oslo_upgradechecks and that can be enabled from
service side during they migrate to YAML format.

Service will enable it like below:

    _upgrade_checks = (
        (_('Policy File JSON to YAML Migration'),
            (common_checks.check_policy_json, {'conf': CONF})),
    )

Also modify the check() method to accept the **kwargs for checks.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: Ifa71c20879c964f794a40b981744d95db4ab1602

commit_message:
Do not set 'always' tag where unnecessary

Makes 'import_tasks' not change behaviour compared to
'include_tasks'.

[{'created': '2020-10-28 16:33:31.000000000', 'message': 'kibana: Fix kibana 6.x migration

In Ansible 2.8, the status_code argument of the uri module should be a
comma-separated string list, rather than a real list. In Ansible 2.6,
the real list worked.

Closes-Bug: #1901614
'}]
commit_message:
kibana: Fix kibana 6.x migration

In Ansible 2.8, the status_code argument of the uri module should be a
comma-separated string list, rather than a real list. In Ansible 2.6,
the real list worked.

Change-Id: If52fd50e0b50f5b32576a6b78af16958a863eb0f
Closes-Bug: #1901614

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/

Change-Id: I92c767de854b11672c17c95b2b6893259d4b4ead

Closes-Bug: #1904435

commit_message:
Use only templates to trigger tests in tripleo-common

Currently a different set of tests triggers in check
and gate due to the job specifications in check
but not in gate. Gate uses the templates.

This review removes the job specifcations in
check to rely on templates in both cases.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/762883
Change-Id: I9308257b6a7ccb3a65f9e590d7894c4bedd57d43
Closes-Bug: #1904435

commit_message:
Add default simple key to secrets

Currently we deploy barbican with weird crypto key. We should generate
unique one with secrets. Also we define `barbican_ceilometer_enabled`
variable to avoid notifications queue overflow caused by absent listener.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/759084
Change-Id: I1732916102dd8cc387d65566f3d3f96038e30e40

commit_message:
Add serial option in tripleo-ansible-inventory script

In order to allow the user to override the serial value
for parallel execution on nodes, this review adds the
--serial option to the tripleo-ansible-inventory script

Depends-On: I6605aec1d42a714f2f2c72b9233bc3bf510177de

commit_message:
Use py2.7 compatible kuryr-tempest-plugin for stable/rocky

stable/rocky python2.7 jobs need to use the py2.7
compatible version of kuryr-tempest-plugin which is
0.5.0. Tempest is already using old Tempest for stable/rocky
- https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/c431116ceb14dc3b75796309a28c33287fcf9a72/stackrc#L316

Change-Id: I4a968a74ac99f31ccc6a0f6a2d74df607c745dc8

commit_message:
Add magnum tempest URL

Since magnum does not have valid way to define type of endpoint,
we hardcode aio private IP, so that it was used during tempest tests.

Change-Id: Ifd43f4292420da31512c001e2caad5f924e566d2

commit_message:
Remove "abc.abstractproperty"

"@abc.abstractproperty" is deprecated since 3.3. Now it's possible
to use "@property" on top of "@abstractmethod".

Change-Id: I0cca37b626a94a05fb983a8528c22a660e89e673

commit_message:
Cleanup stop handler and barbican_apache_* variables

Since handler was added for upgrade purposes, we can drop it now.
We also remove not used barbican_apache_* variables since we've migrated
to the uwsgi usage several releases ago.

Change-Id: Ib19834a1ae4751f7439afaabb532220f873e4b8f

commit_message:
Introduce base personas for secure RBAC

This commit adds some really basic check strings that we can re-use in
the existing policies. These checks strings implement a few of the most
common and useful personas. We're also trying to implement them across
OpenStack consistently, which will improve user experience and security.

commit_message:
Add {{ network.name }}_mtu for all networks to group_vars

For DVR the external bridge is needed also on compute nodes
where there is no 'External' network associated witht the
role. Compute nodes running DVR need the MTU to properly
configured.

Also create a 'network_lower' group_var mapping all
'network.name' to 'network.name_lower'.

NOTE: A follow up can deprecate 'role_networks_lower' once
all Ansible templates are updated to use the 'network_lower'
map.

Related-Bug: #1904809
Change-Id: I5e106874b7809b3b0b8265615863a9b9d35d7c44

Fix ceilometer constraints

We have bumped ceilometer in the integrated repo. However, neutron has
it's own name so it do not respect dumped constraits.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-18 08:56:37.000000000', 'message': 'Restore retrying the RPC connection to conductor

Before Ie15ec8299ae52ae8f5334d591ed3944e9585cf71 if the compute was
started before the conductor then the compute retried the connection
until the conductor was up. The Ie15ec8299ae52ae8f5334d591ed3944e9585cf71
break this behavior as the service version check runs before this RPC
retry mechanism and therefore the compute simply fails to start without
a retry if no conductor is started.

This patch moves the service version check after the RPC connection
retry mechanism.

Conflicts:
      nova/service.py due to Ie15ec8299ae52ae8f5334d591ed3944e9585cf71
      being only a partial backport to stable/victoria

Change-Id: Iad0ba1a02868eebc2f43b1ac843fcc5096cd5c47
Closes-Bug: #1904181
(cherry picked from commit 433bee58bc8d7d65edb6a0805021e51972e6bed6)
'}]
commit_message:
Restore retrying the RPC connection to conductor

Before Ie15ec8299ae52ae8f5334d591ed3944e9585cf71 if the compute was
started before the conductor then the compute retried the connection
until the conductor was up. The Ie15ec8299ae52ae8f5334d591ed3944e9585cf71
break this behavior as the service version check runs before this RPC
retry mechanism and therefore the compute simply fails to start without
a retry if no conductor is started.

This patch moves the service version check after the RPC connection
retry mechanism.

Conflicts:
      nova/service.py due to Ie15ec8299ae52ae8f5334d591ed3944e9585cf71
      being only a partial backport to stable/victoria

Change-Id: Iad0ba1a02868eebc2f43b1ac843fcc5096cd5c47
Closes-Bug: #1904181
(cherry picked from commit 433bee58bc8d7d65edb6a0805021e51972e6bed6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-12 08:23:16.000000000', 'message': 'Improve error handling during service level check

The service level check introduced in
Ie15ec8299ae52ae8f5334d591ed3944e9585cf71 should handle the case when a
compute service is wrongly configured with DB credentials. The previous
patch did not handle this and it caused a misleading error at compute
service startup. This patch makes sure that a user friendly warning is
logged in this case then the service level check is done ignoring the DB
configuration and only checking the local cell.

Change-Id: I89cdf3852266ed93a2ac7cd6261fe269932026ac
Related-Bug: #1871482
(cherry picked from commit 3b44275868e08992a36e9163f533d689f27a0119)
'}, {'created': '2020-11-18 08:32:26.000000000', 'message': 'Improve error handling during service level check

The service level check introduced in
Ie15ec8299ae52ae8f5334d591ed3944e9585cf71 should handle the case when a
compute service is wrongly configured with DB credentials. The previous
patch did not handle this and it caused a misleading error at compute
service startup. This patch makes sure that a user friendly warning is
logged in this case then the service level check is done ignoring the DB
configuration and only checking the local cell.

Change-Id: I89cdf3852266ed93a2ac7cd6261fe269932026ac
Related-Bug: #1871482
(cherry picked from commit 3b44275868e08992a36e9163f533d689f27a0119)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve error handling during service level check

The service level check introduced in
Ie15ec8299ae52ae8f5334d591ed3944e9585cf71 should handle the case when a
compute service is wrongly configured with DB credentials. The previous
patch did not handle this and it caused a misleading error at compute
service startup. This patch makes sure that a user friendly warning is
logged in this case then the service level check is done ignoring the DB
configuration and only checking the local cell.

Change-Id: I89cdf3852266ed93a2ac7cd6261fe269932026ac
Related-Bug: #1871482
(cherry picked from commit 3b44275868e08992a36e9163f533d689f27a0119)

I noticed this change leads to a small breakage of the string freeze.

I don't have a good idea on how to mitigate the problem.
One idea is to keep the string in openstack_dashboard/views.py.

commit_message:
Added validation for csrf_failure GET argument

During csrf_failure argument validation horizon drops unknown messages
so nobody can't inject any message to login view.

Change-Id: I78a7592562a6249629f4d236ca59eb83d9094123
Closes-Bug: #1898465
(cherry picked from commit 8a963626e12ee25cf2f9ab29c172b16f5bbce4c9)

messages:
[{'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-11-14 17:05:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2020-11-14 17:53:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/762737/1 : FAILURE in 48m 08s'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-11-15 08:25:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2020-11-15 10:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Neutron Hyper-V CI

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/762737/2 : FAILURE in 47m 06s'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2020-11-17 15:18:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I don't understand how this makes any difference since the existing code for the nb_global property already calls the DbListCommand?"}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-11-17 17:21:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> I don't understand how this makes any difference since the existing
 > code for the nb_global property already calls the DbListCommand?

Maybe I understood wrong what we talk last friday about this bug. I thought we were accessing to the DB cache directly. But you are right, we are using a dblist command so we use the db_lock."}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2020-11-18 19:00:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yeah. It's still a ReadOnlyCommand, so it does read from the cache. But, those reads are protected by the lock. What I think needs to be done to resolve that issue is to ensure that we do not handle any API requests until the post_fork event fires--like we do in the _ovn_client property. We could just make sure that anything we access is through _ovn_client, or add a decorator for all ML2 method calls that does self._post_fork_event.wait() or something like that."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-11-24 11:03:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This is not the correct approach'}]

commit_message:
Use NB_Global get method from ovsdbapp

Instead of reading the in-memory DB cache, the API provides a
secure method to retrieve the information from this table.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/762730/
Change-Id: I6bec0525f93d98f094b198ab8b45aa65ec92e60c
Related-Bug: #1888878

subject: Remove Six
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23851, 'name': 'Riccardo Pittau', 'email': 'elfosardo@gmail.com', 'username': 'elfosardo'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 30092, 'date': '2020-09-30 00:54:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-10-07 19:28:22.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bp/six-removal'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-11-12 16:13:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

recheck since we don't have artifacts we can't look at the logs :("}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-11-13 13:10:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm not sure we should remove this as six is used by other libraries"}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-11-16 14:38:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm not sure we should remove this as six is used by other
 > libraries

In the grand scheme of the universe, we should be python3 native at this point and why some dependent library may, does it really matter for *us*"}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-11-17 10:29:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> > I'm not sure we should remove this as six is used by other
 > > libraries
 > 
 > In the grand scheme of the universe, we should be python3 native at
 > this point and why some dependent library may, does it really
 > matter for *us*

I totally agree we should kick python2 leftovers in the teeth, but "should" here is mandatory, considering that we have some fundamental libraries used by the ironic projects that still rely on six.
With that said, let's move forward then.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-11-20 11:36:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Low constraints still install six because of other dependencies, we must not remove it.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-11-23 08:56:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

after a quick discussion with some people from openstack requirements, I have to go back to my initial point of view
six needs to stay for the time being as dependency of other libraries'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-11-23 14:52:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Should we abandon this change for now or hold it open?'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-11-24 10:33:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It may take years until all dependencies drop six. I'd just get a habit of checking lower-constraints from time to time. Maybe add to the pre-release checklist?"}]

commit_message:
Limit inspector jobs to 1 testing VM

Currently ironic-base defaults to 2 and our tests try to introspect
all of them. This puts unnecessary strain on the CI systems, return
the number back to 1.

Change-Id: I820bba1347954b659fd7469ed542f98ef0a6eaf0
(cherry picked from commit a141b6f17c701ccb5d87739f605f5c476fbd225c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-20 13:33:19.000000000', 'message': 'Refresh ceph-ansible group_vars values

The purpose of this change is having a mechanism to refresh the
ceph-ansible group_vars/ when a Ceph related service, that defines a
specific set of variables, is included in the overcloud.

For this reason, this patch:

1. Adds the "prepare" tasks (including tripleo-ceph-work-dir) at the
   beginning of Step2. By doing this we can make sure that all the
   variables needed by ceph-ansible are properly collected at Step1,
   and persisted (in group_vars/*) at Step2, before the ceph-ansible
   playbook execution.
   This approach is valid for all the services that define additional
   ConfigOverrides variables

2. Removes the "prepare" (including tripleo-ceph-work-dir) in the rgw
   service: having the "prepare" tasks included "per role" creates the
   risk of executing it multiple times.
   For example, including "prepare" in clients and rgw results in three
   execution of the same thing!
   Adding it at the beginning of Step 2 ensures that it's executed at
   least two times.

Change-Id: If81477ad2c6048b7103810e519083a0870897fa3
(cherry picked from commit 1fafca733c995dc835cbe040c12d766e8ac02cd4)
'}]
commit_message:
Refresh ceph-ansible group_vars values

The purpose of this change is having a mechanism to refresh the
ceph-ansible group_vars/ when a Ceph related service, that defines a
specific set of variables, is included in the overcloud.

For this reason, this patch:

1. Adds the "prepare" tasks (including tripleo-ceph-work-dir) at the
   beginning of Step2. By doing this we can make sure that all the
   variables needed by ceph-ansible are properly collected at Step1,
   and persisted (in group_vars/*) at Step2, before the ceph-ansible
   playbook execution.
   This approach is valid for all the services that define additional
   ConfigOverrides variables

2. Removes the "prepare" (including tripleo-ceph-work-dir) in the rgw
   service: having the "prepare" tasks included "per role" creates the
   risk of executing it multiple times.
   For example, including "prepare" in clients and rgw results in three
   execution of the same thing!
   Adding it at the beginning of Step 2 ensures that it's executed at
   least two times.

Change-Id: If81477ad2c6048b7103810e519083a0870897fa3
(cherry picked from commit 1fafca733c995dc835cbe040c12d766e8ac02cd4)

commit_message:
Fix MetricsQdrUseSSL value

puppet-qdr expects one of the string values 'yes'/'no' instead of boolean,
so currently listeners cannot be created with SSL enabled. This patch is fixing
this issue.

Change-Id: I2dbafdc417f31eb000fbb469ae2c082cda3a5523
(cherry picked from commit dfc3322b637c62b85f450d2ad4aab0aaa1990cb7)

commit_message:
WIP: Change to GPT default instead of bios

Seems we have a slightly larger problem with many things being
in bios when the desire is for uefi, but due to either a lack of
information or configuration, or magical firmware and bios settings,
we end up in a mix where the wrong thing can be done.

Change-Id: Icd478e046faa447e3572b3c5091fb4b268c27339

[{'created': '2020-11-18 13:52:24.000000000', 'message': 'Change qemu user id to match previous releases

The qemu user on the host gets created using uid/gid 107. Certificates
on the host, but also the vhost-user sockets created by ovs use this
uid/gid. With the move to TCIB images the default kolla id were
reverted and the previous overwrite dropped. This make e.g. the qemu
processes to fail to use the libvirt-vnc bind mounted certificates.
This change brings back the previous overwrite of the qemu user
uid/gid.

Closes-Bug: #1903508
Related-Bug: #1900986

Change-Id: I54b9d9f341b521b415a6dccc6c78ae7a77821f6f
(cherry picked from commit 222c67e128620cfd4cc0d65ddd15d73991d486d6)
'}]
commit_message:
Change qemu user id to match previous releases

The qemu user on the host gets created using uid/gid 107. Certificates
on the host, but also the vhost-user sockets created by ovs use this
uid/gid. With the move to TCIB images the default kolla id were
reverted and the previous overwrite dropped. This make e.g. the qemu
processes to fail to use the libvirt-vnc bind mounted certificates.
This change brings back the previous overwrite of the qemu user
uid/gid.

Closes-Bug: #1903508
Related-Bug: #1900986

Change-Id: I54b9d9f341b521b415a6dccc6c78ae7a77821f6f
(cherry picked from commit 222c67e128620cfd4cc0d65ddd15d73991d486d6)

commit_message:
Support configuring multiple Netapp cinder backends

Add support for configuring multiple Netapp cinder backends. The
update also drops some legacy code related to features that were
deprecated several cycles ago (Netapp's e-series hardware, and
storage pool search name patterns).

Change-Id: I15f4828beb9db81583146fa9afdd21999ad5b078

commit_message:
Add max_count argument for clear_expired_data call

When thare're a lot of events in the database panko-expire
consumes a lot of memory to delete all records with a single
call. To avoid this behaviour a new config option
`events_delete_batch_size` was introduced.

Change-Id: Icf83ffe089301b3782273923f18efd4d209131c2
(cherry picked from commit ec84ed8aa7c75d83b50ddac3edb4025462a61084)

commit_message:
bifrost: mark as UNBUILDABLE for aarch64

Upstream probably never used it on !x86-64 as they try to install x86
packages each time:

"msg": "No package matching 'grub-efi-amd64-signed' is available"

I do not plan to work on fixing upstream.

Change-Id: I7a470bf88dd8347bdc1405b0301a1467d40b4206

commit_message:
Code improvements after the dynamic actions patch

* Style improvements to make sure the code is compliant with the
  coding guidelines
* Fixing small but important things like the mismatch between the
  sinatures of the methods find_all() in the DynamicActionProvider
  class and the base ActionProvider interface.
* Improved the tests.
* Simplified the implementation of DynamicActionProvider.

Change-Id: Idbfb15b4c3bb415e7fa9c7ece27eabfe674b6059

[{'created': '2020-08-21 08:48:51.000000000', 'message': 'Set up nova-scheduler processes based on worker-multiplier

Upstream Nova introduced multiple scheduler support in Rocky. Apply the
number of scheduler workers based on worker-multiplier so users can
control resource consumption instead of having the same number of
workers with the available CPU threads.

Change-Id: Ia6f14a98ce3e5649f290561f59d691ded3d19177
Closes-Bug: #1889756
'}]
commit_message:
Set up nova-scheduler processes based on worker-multiplier

Upstream Nova introduced multiple scheduler support in Rocky. Apply the
number of scheduler workers based on worker-multiplier so users can
control resource consumption instead of having the same number of
workers with the available CPU threads.

Change-Id: Ia6f14a98ce3e5649f290561f59d691ded3d19177
Closes-Bug: #1889756

commit_message:
Fix libvirt's package name in bindep

We recently moved the release job `publish-openstack-artifacts`
on ubuntu-focal [1][2][3].

Unfortunatelly python-libvirt doesn't exist in this distro and this
leaded us to facing a related issue during the PyPi upload of
masakari-monitors.

As said previously, tag 9.0.1 wasn't uploaded to PyPi [4][5], and it will stay
in this state. These changes will fix the upload issue and it will allow us to
upload to PyPi a version 9.0.2.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018584.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018608.html
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/761776/
[4] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2020-November/001486.html
[5] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/762549/

Change-Id: I41253d2e30191eac8a94de132b47be4b67bd248b

on ubuntu-focal [1][2][3].

Unfortunatelly python-libvirt doesn't exist in this distro and this
leaded us to facing a related issue during the PyPi upload of

As said previously, tag 8.0.2 wasn't uploaded to PyPi [4][5], and it will stay

commit_message:
Fix libvirt's package name in bindep

We recently moved the release job `publish-openstack-artifacts`
on ubuntu-focal [1][2][3].

Unfortunatelly python-libvirt doesn't exist in this distro and this
leaded us to facing a related issue during the PyPi upload of
masakari-monitors.

As said previously, tag 7.0.1 wasn't uploaded to PyPi [4][5], and it will stay
in this state. These changes will fix the upload issue and it will allow us to
upload to PyPi a version 7.0.2.
