 > opinion - is it really possible that one would desire to have the
 > same export location for share from the same host with two
 > different protocols?
 > 
 > Let's hold off on merging this today, and gather views

The test doesn't represent the actual expected export paths. I believe that we can improve this in this tests and in lot of other tests that use these kind of fake names.
NFS and CIFs shouldn't have the same export locations, according to the protocol design, but can we guarantee that different implementations of the protocols/storage systems don't provide a unified representation of the export path, ike everything in UNC? Not sure about that.'}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2020-09-25 13:02:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

> i think  it really possible that one would desire to have the same
 > export location for share from the same host with two different
 > protocols, For example, in ceph storage clusters,Just configure a
 > share path in the configuration files of Ganesha(ganesha.conf) and
 > SAMB(smb.conf) to be the same path.And we can actually mount the
 > same path through both protocols.

Besides CIFS and NFS have different protocol designs with different path patterns, where CIFS demands UNC syntax, and NFS a format like 'server:/dir', i believe that some server/client implementation might use interchangeably those syntax independent of the protocol. But this is a guess. 
I believe that, yes, we can use the protocol in this db search."}, {'account_id': 30002, 'date': '2020-09-25 13:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-09-29 22:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

> i think  it really possible that one would desire to have the same export location for share from the same host with two different protocols, For example, in ceph storage clusters,Just configure a share path in the configuration files of Ganesha(ganesha.conf) and SAMB(smb.conf) to be the same path.And we can actually mount the same path through both protocols.


Hi Haixin, 

I'm not sure I understand this entirely. Yes, it's probably possible that many storage systems such as Ceph, NetApp, Dell/EMC can support exporting the same share in two different protocols - and as Douglas noted, the export locations are bound to look different even if the same share is exported to two different protocols. However, manila doesn't support multi-protocol shares - i.e., if you have an NFS share, you cannot mount it using CephFS for example, even if that is theoretically possible. The reason here is that the ACL mechanisms and the individual file permission metadata is fundamentally different for these protocols. 

So, I don't think the check for duplicate shares should include protocol.. if someone wishes to "manage" the same share with two different protocols, that must explicitly be disallowed.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-10-15 15:36:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

Haixin, 

can you please take a look at the question - if necessary we can discuss this at the upcoming PTG. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2020-10-16 07:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2020-10-16 07:56:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

hi, Goutham Pacha Ravi.
thanks for your review.
I looked at the problem carefully again,
as Douglas noted, the export locations are bound to look different
even if the same share is exported to two different protocols.
that is right.
So what I said before is how to export a share(dir) with NFS and CIFS
protocol.For example in ceph cluster:
in /etc/ganesha.conf
EXPORT {
    Export_id = 137;
	Path = /manila/share_433e611b_e601_459b_aedf_5a;
	Pseudo = /manila/share_433e611b_e601_459b_aedf_5a;
	PrivilegedPort = True;
	Access_Type = RW;
	Disable_RW = false;
	Squash = no_root_squash;
	FSAL {
	    Name = CEPH;
	}
}

in /etc/samb/smb.conf
[share_433e611b_e601_459b_aedf_5a]
public = no
valid_users = invalid_user_nologin
path = /manila/share_433e611b_e601_459b_aedf_5a
writeable = yes
printable = no
directory mask = 0777
vfs objects = ceph
create mask = 0777
ceph:config_file = /etc/ceph/ceph.conf

we can see that they have same path.
But I missed one thing earlier, they aslo have different
export locations in manila.
For NFS, export location is:
100.7.50.75:/manila/share_433e611b_e601_459b_aedf_5a
For CIFS, export location is:
\\100.7.50.75\share_433e611b_e601_459b_aedf_5a
they are different.

Finally, i gree it's not necessary check duplicate shares
with protocol. i will remove it.
and add share_server_id if user provides."}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2020-10-16 08:00:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

The location of NFS configuration file should be
/etc/ganesha/ganesha.conf, not /etc/ganesha.conf(wrong above)'}, {'account_id': 21884, 'date': '2020-10-16 09:45:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

[{'created': '2020-09-01 03:06:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed the logic that determines whether a share exists before manage a share

when we manage a share use manila client,will meet
ERROR: Invalid share: Share already exists.
But this share does not exist in the database, manila prompts that the
share already exists,This is obviously not true.

Analysis of the code found that Manila has a problem in determining
whether the share exists in the query mechanism,It does not use host and
protocol as valid query criteria.
And the parameter of export_location_path are not used correctly.

Closes-Bug:#1893718

'}, {'created': '2020-09-23 23:02:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix logic that determines a share exists before manage

The share "manage" API checks whether
an existing/known share is being imported by
matching the export path provided to existing
shares.

This lookup does not consider the
fact that shares may have multiple export
locations, because it relies on an old/deprecated
"export_location" property on shares which
was added to provide backwards compatibility
to the API that presented only one export
location per share.

Further, it's possible to get a
"ERROR: Invalid share: Share already exists"
exception even when no such share exists in the
database.

Fix the lookup by using the "export_location_path"
based lookup which is faster, since it performs
a meaningful join on the export locations table;
and remove the parameters "host", "protocol"
and "share_type_id" - these things make no
difference when there's a duplicated export
location.

Closes-Bug: #1848608
Closes-Bug: #1893718
Change-Id: I1d1aef0c2b48764789b43b91b258def6464b389f
Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-09-24 00:37:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix logic that determines a share exists before manage

The share "manage" API checks whether
an existing/known share is being imported by
matching the export path provided to existing
shares.

This lookup does not consider the
fact that shares may have multiple export
locations, because it relies on an old/deprecated
"export_location" property on shares which
was added to provide backwards compatibility
to the API that presented only one export
location per share.

Further, it's possible to get a
"ERROR: Invalid share: Share already exists"
exception even when no such share exists in the
database.

Fix the lookup by using the "export_location_path"
based lookup which is faster, since it performs
a meaningful join on the export locations table;
and remove the parameters "host", "protocol"
and "share_type_id" - these things make no
difference when there's a duplicated export
location.

Closes-Bug: #1848608
Closes-Bug: #1893718
Change-Id: I1d1aef0c2b48764789b43b91b258def6464b389f
Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-09-24 00:51:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix logic that determines a share exists before manage

The share "manage" API checks whether
an existing/known share is being imported by
matching the export path provided to existing
shares.

This lookup does not consider the
fact that shares may have multiple export
locations, because it relies on an old/deprecated
"export_location" property on shares which
was added to provide backwards compatibility
to the API that presented only one export
location per share.

Further, it's possible to get a
"ERROR: Invalid share: Share already exists"
exception even when no such share exists in the
database.

Fix the lookup by using the "export_location_path"
based lookup which is faster, since it performs
a meaningful join on the export locations table;
and remove the parameters "host", "protocol"
and "share_type_id" - these things make no
difference when there's a duplicated export
location.

Closes-Bug: #1848608
Closes-Bug: #1893718

'}, {'created': '2020-09-24 19:37:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix logic that determines a share exists before manage

The share "manage" API checks whether
an existing/known share is being imported by
matching the export path provided to existing
shares.

This lookup does not consider the
fact that shares may have multiple export
locations, because it relies on an old/deprecated
"export_location" property on shares which
was added to provide backwards compatibility
to the API that presented only one export
location per share.

Further, it's possible to get a
"ERROR: Invalid share: Share already exists"
exception even when no such share exists in the
database.

Fix the lookup by using the "export_location_path"
based lookup which is faster, since it performs
a meaningful join on the export locations table;
and remove the parameters "protocol"
and "share_type_id" - these things make no
difference when there's a duplicated export
location. We'll consider "host" as a lookup
parameter since we can't be sure that export
locations are unique in a deployment - but they
ought to be unique for a given host.

Closes-Bug: #1848608
Closes-Bug: #1893718
Change-Id: I1d1aef0c2b48764789b43b91b258def6464b389f
Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

Fix the lookup by using the "export_location_path"
based lookup which is faster, since it performs
a meaningful join on the export locations table;
and remove the parameters "protocol"
and "share_type_id" - these things make no
difference when there's a duplicated export
location. We'll consider "host" as a lookup
parameter since we can't be sure that export
locations are unique in a deployment - but they
ought to be unique for a given host.

commit_message:
Fix logic that determines a share exists before manage

The share "manage" API checks whether
an existing/known share is being imported by
matching the export path provided to existing
shares.

This lookup does not consider the
fact that shares may have multiple export
locations, because it relies on an old/deprecated
"export_location" property on shares which
was added to provide backwards compatibility
to the API that presented only one export
location per share.

Further, it's possible to get a
"ERROR: Invalid share: Share already exists"
exception even when no such share exists in the
database.

Fix the lookup by using the "export_location_path"
based lookup which is faster, since it performs
a meaningful join on the export locations table;
and remove the parameters "protocol"
and "share_type_id" - these things make no
difference when there's a duplicated export
location. We'll consider "host" as a lookup
parameter since we can't be sure that export
locations are unique in a deployment - but they
ought to be unique for a given host.

Closes-Bug: #1848608
Closes-Bug: #1893718
Change-Id: I1d1aef0c2b48764789b43b91b258def6464b389f
Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fixed data_files

In order to package ansible-role-collect-logs, we need to put the
roles under /usr/share not in /usr/local/share so that system ansible
discovers this role.

Remove setup.cfg file from irrelevant files to avoid job freeze.

Change-Id: Ifbc7cec6daa24c317636406100ca8cd860165ffd
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

Ignore any file patterns containing molecule from triggering
deployment jobs. Altering only molecule related files should
not trigger extra jobs.

commit_message:
Make local molecule testing running.

There has been an update in the zuul fact's structure, having now
a projects index which contains the src_dir parameter. This update
was done in run.yaml, however it was missed to be adapted for the
run-local.yml and the pre.yml.

This change adds the fact tripleo_validations_project_path in pre.yml
and updates the zuul dictionary in run-local.yml.

Change-Id: I25ccc7d7a70a64c5abc1a5d621817b2dfad6e38f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 18002, 'name': 'John Fulton', 'email': 'fulton@redhat.com', 'username': 'fultonj'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages: [{'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-11-20 13:28:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-11-23 07:50:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-11-23 13:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-20 13:28:38.000000000', 'message': 'Refresh ceph-ansible group_vars values

The purpose of this change is having a mechanism to refresh the
ceph-ansible group_vars/ when a Ceph related service, that defines a
specific set of variables, is included in the overcloud.

For this reason, this patch:

1. Adds the "prepare" tasks (including tripleo-ceph-work-dir) at the
   beginning of Step2. By doing this we can make sure that all the
   variables needed by ceph-ansible are properly collected at Step1,
   and persisted (in group_vars/*) at Step2, before the ceph-ansible
   playbook execution.
   This approach is valid for all the services that define additional
   ConfigOverrides variables

2. Removes the "prepare" (including tripleo-ceph-work-dir) in the rgw
   service: having the "prepare" tasks included "per role" creates the
   risk of executing it multiple times.
   For example, including "prepare" in clients and rgw results in three
   execution of the same thing!
   Adding it at the beginning of Step 2 ensures that it's executed at
   least two times.

Change-Id: If81477ad2c6048b7103810e519083a0870897fa3
(cherry picked from commit 1fafca733c995dc835cbe040c12d766e8ac02cd4)
'}]
commit_message:
Refresh ceph-ansible group_vars values

The purpose of this change is having a mechanism to refresh the
ceph-ansible group_vars/ when a Ceph related service, that defines a
specific set of variables, is included in the overcloud.

For this reason, this patch:

1. Adds the "prepare" tasks (including tripleo-ceph-work-dir) at the
   beginning of Step2. By doing this we can make sure that all the
   variables needed by ceph-ansible are properly collected at Step1,
   and persisted (in group_vars/*) at Step2, before the ceph-ansible
   playbook execution.
   This approach is valid for all the services that define additional
   ConfigOverrides variables

2. Removes the "prepare" (including tripleo-ceph-work-dir) in the rgw
   service: having the "prepare" tasks included "per role" creates the
   risk of executing it multiple times.
   For example, including "prepare" in clients and rgw results in three
   execution of the same thing!
   Adding it at the beginning of Step 2 ensures that it's executed at
   least two times.

Change-Id: If81477ad2c6048b7103810e519083a0870897fa3
(cherry picked from commit 1fafca733c995dc835cbe040c12d766e8ac02cd4)

[{'created': '2020-09-18 10:22:00.000000000', 'message': "Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: I7ea008e1d1b83b9ad264b6846de8ab16780c9528
"}]
commit_message:
Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: I7ea008e1d1b83b9ad264b6846de8ab16780c9528

commit_message:
Run autoremove on post-install step

Autoremove can touch packages, that are assumed to be present
for post-install step.

A good example is dkms, which is dropped in
install.d, but dkms element try to use it in post-install step.
This results in the following log [1]

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/797809/

Change-Id: I635af230c6b250fee273039935cf19506e83b3d1

commit_message:
Make create_disk() persistent

Right now a system configured with the ceph plugin will not survive
a reboot because the backing disk we create and mount isn't mounted
at startup, preventing ceph from starting and the rest of nova/glance
from working.

This makes create_disk() idempotently write an fstab rule for the
disk we make, and adds a destroy_disk() handler for cleanup.

Change-Id: I50cd4234f51a335af25be756bd2459dca5aa343c

i agree with this discussion, yes in case of gates ,we are full aware that no user will create loopback devices and in case of developer environment will update the docs about this so that they will  update the service file as per their need(https://review.opendev.org/#/c/761676/)'}, {'account_id': 8863, 'date': '2020-11-23 21:40:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2020-11-23 21:59:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Hi Joe,
   Is there anyway to test this?   I don't have ceph or a way to quickly get a system setup to test rbd attaches/detaches.   Any connector that lands will be used by Cinder (and eventually Nova) for doing volume attaches.  Cinder's test case is basically the copy volume to image and image to volume tests.   Do we have a way to CI this connector to ensure it works for the Cinder use cases at least.    

Also,
  I looked at the LibvirtNetVolumeDriver in Nova, which is the handler for rbd based volumes, and it seems quite different than this code."}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2015-06-10 16:29:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-06-10 18:57:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-os-brick-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/72/186172/3/check/gate-os-brick-pep8/b8ee4d9/ : SUCCESS in 28s
- gate-os-brick-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/72/186172/3/check/gate-os-brick-docs/c01605c//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 52s
- gate-os-brick-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/72/186172/3/check/gate-os-brick-python27/1f06248/ : SUCCESS in 37s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-os-brick http://logs.openstack.org/72/186172/3/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-os-brick/3db1fc7/ : SUCCESS in 58m 01s'}, {'account_id': 9236, 'date': '2015-06-11 20:37:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Hi Joe,
>
> Is there anyway to test this?   I don't have ceph or a way
> to quickly get a system setup to test rbd
> attaches/detaches.

Without a ceph cluster you would not be able to test
connecting to a ceph cluster and performing I/O on an RBD
image.

> Any connector that lands will be used by Cinder (and
> eventually Nova) for doing volume attaches.

I think I understand what you're asking, your concern is
that since Cinder does not use this connector and os-brick
is not being tested in the gate, any breakages or
regressions would go unnoticed.

The initial intent is to add support for RBD volume
migration, so this connector implements the minimum
necessary to allow this feature.  The next step is update
the Cinder RBD driver to make use of this connector.  Since
ceph is voting in the gate, I believe you would then have
the testing assurance that you're hoping for.  The step
after that (or in parallel depending on how you look at it)
is to add volume migration tests to tempest so that all of
the existing code paths are properly covered.

Is it possible to merge this connector so that RBD volume
migration can land, and then work on tempest tests for
migration testing in general?  The latter is going to be
a non-trivial amount of work and I would like to offer
something to RBD users for the L release, and hopefully work
on improving test coverage in parallel.

> Cinder's test case is basically the copy volume to image
> and image to volume tests.

Volume migration (between two different backends) is what
I'm initially targeting.

> Also, I looked at the LibvirtNetVolumeDriver in Nova,
> which is the handler for rbd based volumes, and it seems
> quite different than this code.

It is, and there is a considerable amount of libvirt
knowledge in there as well.  Perhaps some of the most basic
elements could be shared (cluster connection, volume
operations, ...) but I need to look at the Nova side closer
to say for sure.  Even if nova doesn't make use of this
connector, the value to Cinder I think is well worth it."}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2015-06-11 21:29:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

Thanks for the clarification Jon.   Lets get this guy to land.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2015-06-11 21:53:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Thanks for clarifying the scope of this change, Jon.  The change looks good to me except the log format Walt mentioned.  For Eric's question about offset being wrong if rbd_image.read() failed, I don't see a trivial way to avoid such failure, I guess we have to trust librbd to be reliable?"}, {'account_id': 9236, 'date': '2015-06-12 17:13:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9236, 'date': '2015-06-12 17:16:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Added test coverage for the volume I/O wrapper class

Walt: comment updated, thanks for the input

Winston: this version preserves the file offset in the event of read() failure.  Let me know what you think.'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2015-06-12 17:22:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9236, 'date': '2015-06-12 17:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2015-06-12 18:33:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

> For Eric's question about offset being wrong if rbd_image.read() failed, I don't see a trivial way to avoid such failure, I guess we have to trust librbd to be reliable?

You don't have to trust librbd to be reliable -- just need to somehow maintain consistent state in the connector if there is a failure.  This could be by resetting the current offset, or putting the whole object in some failed state where all further operations fail, etc.

Currently the result after failure is a still-existing file-like object with unknown behavior, which isn't safe."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-06-12 20:30:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

This seems fine for volume migration.

librbd in general won't give you errors from read or write calls, since filesystems on top of rbd don't handle that well.

Instead it'll retry things internally (basically the only error that can happen is ENOSPC), mainly inside of librados.

The kinds of failure that librbd will report are things like auth problems, or an initial timeout connecting, but those would be caught by trying to connect in the first place."}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2015-06-17 07:02:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Josh's comment and +1 is helpful.  I'd leverage his expertise on librados."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2015-06-17 13:08:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

commit_message:
Add RBD connector

This connector allows RBD volumes to be accessed for I/O operations such
as volume migration.  The intent is to slowly move cinder's RBD code
that could be shared into this connector so that we may eventually share
with nova.

Blueprint: generic-volume-migration
Blueprint: add-rbd-support-to-cinder-brick
Change-Id: I9de951d01d27b983de724e214b4b89fd55f19aa8

Services that use WSME return errors using a json document that contains
'faultstring' in the root object instead of a dict within a dict.

Story: 2008381
Task: 41303

commit_message:
Fix exception parsing when using WSME

Services that use WSME return errors using a json document that contains
'faultstring' in the root object instead of a dict within a dict.

Change-Id: I25d8c64860de7eafb8d543ebcb519fc9664d563e
Story: 2008381
Task: 41303

commit_message:
ovn: Add a gap about e/w traffic fragmentation

OVN doesn't implement the e/w traffic fragmentation and probably never
will. Add the gap to our docs.

Change-Id: Ib61279d49b460e8cc458d92795f4a73d0ac4bb5f
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
start using available_features cfg option from tempest

[1] introduced a new list cfg option to tempest network-feature-enabled
available_features, which can list networking features without and
API extension.
As a first candidate ipv6_metadata can be added to master and victoria
jobs.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/760916

Change-Id: Ib8ba513ad098bb47d401ba64311b92280a85e1b2

commit_message:
add workaround to disable multiple port bindings

This change adds a workaround config option to allow
disabling the multiple port bindings workflow
as a temporay mitigation to bug: #1815989
where the RARP mac learning packets sent by qemu are lost
on migration resulting in ta loss of network connectivity
until the vm sends a packet.

Change-Id: I1f8c9a2595a489f3ba7a6fff2fb74ae246c9ff8f
Related-Bug: #185989

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-28 06:20:25.000000000', 'message': 'enable host shuffeling by default

This change enables best same weighed host shuffeling
and sets host_subset_size to 3 by default.

This will improve the reliablity fo multi create or concurrent boot requests
by adding addtionally entorpy in the host selecton.

the host subset_size of 3 was chosen to match our current retry limit
and is a better default for any cloud over ~30 hosts.

host subset size shoudl be small (1 to 2 orders of magnitude smaller)
with respect to the total number of hosts in the clould and propotal
(within an order of magnitude) to the size of a typical multi create
size or concurrent creates expected.

e.g. if you have a 500 node cloud with a typical multi create or concurrent create
size of 100 instances then the lower bound given by the size of the cloud
would be in the region fo 5-50 and the upper bound given by the size of the create
would be of the oder of 1-10. so from that the ideal starting point for tunening
subset size for this cloud and work load would be between 5-10 biased to the lower
end of that range.

Change-Id: I28b25d1834b5b8b0a80bc9c290de6786d1136fd1
'}]
commit_message:
enable host shuffeling by default

This change enables best same weighed host shuffeling
and sets host_subset_size to 3 by default.

This will improve the reliablity fo multi create or concurrent boot requests
by adding addtionally entorpy in the host selecton.

the host subset_size of 3 was chosen to match our current retry limit
and is a better default for any cloud over ~30 hosts.

host subset size shoudl be small (1 to 2 orders of magnitude smaller)
with respect to the total number of hosts in the clould and propotal
(within an order of magnitude) to the size of a typical multi create
size or concurrent creates expected.

e.g. if you have a 500 node cloud with a typical multi create or concurrent create
size of 100 instances then the lower bound given by the size of the cloud
would be in the region fo 5-50 and the upper bound given by the size of the create
would be of the oder of 1-10. so from that the ideal starting point for tunening
subset size for this cloud and work load would be between 5-10 biased to the lower
end of that range.

Change-Id: I28b25d1834b5b8b0a80bc9c290de6786d1136fd1

Dep's should be restricted by tox-constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building docs which may
not be supported by stable and lower branches, so should be
restricted by respective version's tox-constraints.txt

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-23 07:26:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix: create qcow2 image on glance cinder nfs

Currently when extending a qcow2 image-volume, cinder assumes it
to be a qcow2 volume and errors out due to image virtual_size > volume_size
This patch eliminates the need to extend the volume by creating the
volume as the size of the actual image hence avoiding unnecessary
calls to the cinder extend volume API which leads to performance
improvement in case of large images (that require multiple extend calls).

Change-Id: Ia4a59c8f7c5ac11dc49948cabbc7df186826f3c1
Closes-Bug: 1901138
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: create qcow2 image on glance cinder nfs

Currently when extending a qcow2 image-volume, cinder assumes it
to be a qcow2 volume and errors out due to image virtual_size > volume_size
This patch eliminates the need to extend the volume by creating the
volume as the size of the actual image hence avoiding unnecessary
calls to the cinder extend volume API which leads to performance
improvement in case of large images (that require multiple extend calls).

Change-Id: Ia4a59c8f7c5ac11dc49948cabbc7df186826f3c1
Closes-Bug: 1901138

commit_message:
Fix conditionals/types in check_flavors and verify_profiles

Existing resources "DISK_GB", "MEMORY_MB", "VCPU" were not considered to
be available in case of custom_resource_class_val == False, also use correct
types for resource comparison and required_count calculation.

Change-Id: Ia194cebaeb7dcc40b4011e50cdde7648b4bf87b1
Closes-Bug: #1905018

subject: Add known_hosts entries for additional Gerrit keys
messages: [{'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-11-23 18:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-11-23 18:45:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-11-23 19:50:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-23 18:12:55.000000000', 'message': "Add known_hosts entries for additional Gerrit keys

Gerrit has shuffled the order in which it returns host keys, and
ssh clients can get confused if the first host key type they support
in the list isn't included in the known_hosts file already. Just go
ahead and include all the host keys our Gerrit provides.

Change-Id: I15cdf24d9b3a372a7c8ad1aef97baa3b5eeefab0
"}]
commit_message:
Add known_hosts entries for additional Gerrit keys

Gerrit has shuffled the order in which it returns host keys, and
ssh clients can get confused if the first host key type they support
in the list isn't included in the known_hosts file already. Just go
ahead and include all the host keys our Gerrit provides.

Change-Id: I15cdf24d9b3a372a7c8ad1aef97baa3b5eeefab0

There is a 2.10 stable branch now, let's start testing it.

Let's not go super crazy with the cross-version matrix yet though.

commit_message:
Make mdadm a soft requirement

No point in requiring it for deployments that don't use software RAID.

Change-Id: I8b40f02cc81d3154f98fa3f2cbb4d3c7319291b8

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead

Change-Id: Ie36f12a4a6dd3c06b9ffd9bfb7bbb0106311820f

[{'created': '2020-11-13 06:37:17.000000000', 'message': "Fixes the issue that instance bond port can't get IP address

The issue is that when a port group doesn't have a mac address assigned by
operators, and during provisioning we unbind/bind tenant port with None which
causes the mac address to be regenerated twice and differs from the originally
one allocated by nova or users which was packed into config drive. The end result
is that, bond port has different mac address configured and can't the IP address
from neutron.

Change-Id: I92ed5d17239216324d6a69e0ed8771fd6948d6ec
Story: 2008300
Task: 41185
(cherry picked from commit fe01ddb2bce12dc1693d64a30e5b1b822e7b839e)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes the issue that instance bond port can't get IP address

The issue is that when a port group doesn't have a mac address assigned by
operators, and during provisioning we unbind/bind tenant port with None which
causes the mac address to be regenerated twice and differs from the originally
one allocated by nova or users which was packed into config drive. The end result
is that, bond port has different mac address configured and can't the IP address
from neutron.

Change-Id: I92ed5d17239216324d6a69e0ed8771fd6948d6ec
Story: 2008300
Task: 41185
(cherry picked from commit fe01ddb2bce12dc1693d64a30e5b1b822e7b839e)

[{'created': '2020-10-04 12:29:23.000000000', 'message': 'CI: update bindep for centos-8 py36 job changes

Opendev infra changed py36 defaults to run on centos8 and
of course, there is no python-devel mapping on centos.

Removed the entry and adjusted the test-setup.sh script
so the databases are started locally as they are not auto
started upon installation.

Change-Id: I826757ad73b0b14f119f9205475379b85f111383
(cherry picked from commit eac7226ce29bc291b4b9bdc34775b22b147f9f72)
'}]
commit_message:
CI: update bindep for centos-8 py36 job changes

Opendev infra changed py36 defaults to run on centos8 and
of course, there is no python-devel mapping on centos.

Removed the entry and adjusted the test-setup.sh script
so the databases are started locally as they are not auto
started upon installation.

Change-Id: I826757ad73b0b14f119f9205475379b85f111383
(cherry picked from commit eac7226ce29bc291b4b9bdc34775b22b147f9f72)

commit_message:
virt: Remove 'change_instance_metadata' API

This was used to propagate the metadata changes to the hypervisor. For
all non-XenAPI drivers, we still allow updating instance metadata via
the API (i.e. '/servers/{server_id}/metadata') but this simply changes
what is exposed via the metadata API.

Change-Id: Ibd0ffd9906e7d7f22a9233539091d450e8023f07
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

subject: ssync: Fix traceback when no updates are sent
messages: [{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2020-11-23 14:37:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-23 14:37:00.000000000', 'message': "ssync: Fix traceback when no updates are sent

When an ssync sender detects that all hashes are in sync and there are
no updates to perform, it sends the ':UPDATES: START' and 'UPDATES:
END' handshake tokens to the receiver with no hash data between
them. However, when an ssync sender has remote_check_objs it performs
the missing check phase of the ssync protocol but does not perform the
updates phase, regardless of the sync status. Previously, in this
case, the sender would not even send the ':UPDATES: START' and
'UPDATES: END' handshake tokens, and the receiver would receive an
empty line after the ':MISSING: END' token. This would cause the
receiver to log an exception because it was expecting 'UPDATES:
START'.

This patch changes the ssync sender to always send the updates
handshake tokens even when there are no updates due to
remote_check_objs being set. The receiver should therefore always
receive the handshake token that it expects.

Change-Id: I1ab8761083ab76657f3690e9a77367e58af430c9
"}]
commit_message:
ssync: Fix traceback when no updates are sent

When an ssync sender detects that all hashes are in sync and there are
no updates to perform, it sends the ':UPDATES: START' and 'UPDATES:
END' handshake tokens to the receiver with no hash data between
them. However, when an ssync sender has remote_check_objs it performs
the missing check phase of the ssync protocol but does not perform the
updates phase, regardless of the sync status. Previously, in this
case, the sender would not even send the ':UPDATES: START' and
'UPDATES: END' handshake tokens, and the receiver would receive an
empty line after the ':MISSING: END' token. This would cause the
receiver to log an exception because it was expecting 'UPDATES:
START'.

This patch changes the ssync sender to always send the updates
handshake tokens even when there are no updates due to
remote_check_objs being set. The receiver should therefore always
receive the handshake token that it expects.

Change-Id: I1ab8761083ab76657f3690e9a77367e58af430c9

[{'created': '2020-11-16 12:03:50.000000000', 'message': "Ensure resource_provider_bandwitdhs is unset by default

Currently puppet-neutron supports the resource_provider_bandwidths
parameter for ovs agent and sriov agent, but it doesn't provide the way
to clear existing settings.

This change makes sure that the resource_provider_bandwiths parameter
is unset by default so that operators can reset the parameter to
the default value defined in neutron service itself.

Change-Id: Icd834f4f4ca6578c836935614931af2a3e79bf7d

commit_message:
Ensure resource_provider_bandwitdhs is unset by default

Currently puppet-neutron supports the resource_provider_bandwidths
parameter for ovs agent and sriov agent, but it doesn't provide the way
to clear existing settings.

This change makes sure that the resource_provider_bandwiths parameter
is unset by default so that operators can reset the parameter to
the default value defined in neutron service itself.

Change-Id: Icd834f4f4ca6578c836935614931af2a3e79bf7d

commit_message:
Update RDO to use Victoria release

Seems like we were still using Ussuri's RDO to get openvswitch package
and now that it broke it's an issue. This commit updates that to use
Victoria RDO release.

Change-Id: Ide317ac064dcc2a1a2e2bdbf8129bd9021f57a0d

It enables extensions like fip_qos and gateway_ip_qos in the
L3 agent.

commit_message:
Config options for AMQP1 transport in collectd sensubility

This patch exposes configuration options for setting up collectd
sensubility to use AMQP1 transport. This is primarily for
compatability with the Service Telemetry Framework.

Change-Id: Id74eb494e022e88f0a1d5c1044d3a7a283b5178f
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/760122/
(cherry picked from commit 6fef2d86b2d65801e8fb8514e5e5ba783715076a)
(cherry picked from commit 0b58b547b6d739034a9462933ac3f8f418bbbe70)

commit_message:
Move fwaas_v2_log constants to neutron-lib

The neutron_fwaas.services.logapi.constants are rehomed into
neutron-lib.services.logapi.constants as they are used in the
former. In addition, 'FIREWALL_LOG_DRIVER_NAME' is moved to
neutron-lib.

Change-Id: I152632791475a2dff0bc41b864e186dadcf4e9c0
Closes-bug: #1848851

commit_message:
Fix podman and buildah only on rhel-8.2

Newer rhel version will provide newer tools, let's allow them for now
and decide if we must get some new redhat-8.3.yml and so on.

Change-Id: I81434e914d9c84a093f726181f7bb4a9b2042062
(cherry picked from commit c2365b3ab7a8051f15ec40db32d9b585fc6b8d32)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-22 06:00:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix openvswitch gate issue with systemd 237-3ubuntu10.43

New systemd 237-3ubuntu10.43 bumps memlock limit from 16 to 64 MB [1]
which seems to cause issues with eBPF related operations in containers
run with root [2] as a possible root cause.

Here we have an option to downgrade systemd to previous available
version or to set previous default memlock limit to systemd defaults or
docker unit. Setting systemd DefaultLimitMEMLOCK in this commit.

[1] https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/systemd/237-3ubuntu10.43
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/systemd/+bug/1837580/comments/9

Change-Id: I55d14ffa47a7a29d059f2f3b502bb38be0a5dd3d
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

commit_message:
Fix openvswitch gate issue with systemd 237-3ubuntu10.43

New systemd 237-3ubuntu10.43 bumps memlock limit from 16 to 64 MB [1]
which seems to cause issues with eBPF related operations in containers
run with root [2] as a possible root cause.

Here we have an option to downgrade systemd to previous available
version or to set previous default memlock limit to systemd defaults or
docker unit. Setting systemd DefaultLimitMEMLOCK in this commit.

[1] https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/systemd/237-3ubuntu10.43
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/systemd/+bug/1837580/comments/9

Change-Id: I55d14ffa47a7a29d059f2f3b502bb38be0a5dd3d
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

commit_message:
Ignore InstanceNotFound exception when host rejoin cluster

Nova-compute would start failed if there are instances which were
evacuated and then deleted.

This patch ignores such exception.

Change-Id: Ibfe17ed800edd1631c580b47f6236a7229455b4f
Closes-Bug: #1897716

commit_message:
OVN Services status reporting

This patch is proposing how OVN services(ovn-controller
and metadata agent) can register and periodically report
status to neutron server.

Related-Bug: #1719574
Change-Id: I9113677da68f9cd9a4ad6ad499b963740a36c443

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-23 15:30:23.000000000', 'message': 'Run tag-releases on ubuntu-focal

The tag-releases job installs a distro package of git-review to use
for interacting with Gerrit, but since our Gerrit upgrade to 3.2 the
git-review 1.26 in Ubuntu Bionic is too old to work with it
correctly. Switch this job to run on ubuntu-focal nodes where it
will get a new enough git-review 1.27 instead.

Change-Id: Icb5042525bc0f2ddfaa8be24b3b3ed0e5fb2c625
'}]
commit_message:
Run tag-releases on ubuntu-focal

The tag-releases job installs a distro package of git-review to use
for interacting with Gerrit, but since our Gerrit upgrade to 3.2 the
git-review 1.26 in Ubuntu Bionic is too old to work with it
correctly. Switch this job to run on ubuntu-focal nodes where it
will get a new enough git-review 1.27 instead.

Change-Id: Icb5042525bc0f2ddfaa8be24b3b3ed0e5fb2c625

commit_message:
Turn-on dstat again

dstat seems to be enabled in a lot of devstack jobs today so it should
be working fine.
Enabling it will help us to understand RAM/CPU consumption when a job
fails.

Change-Id: I2cb64b33d82bacc3ef173eadc36b3e01c2c04f84

fip agent gw ports may be left in DB after router removal due to
race condition between l3 agent and server: when server processes
"router delete" - l3 agent is still processing "router add" and creates
fip agent gw port after server already removed the router.

The patch also adds handling of external network delete event
to cleanup fip namespaces left on agents due to same race condition.

Change-Id: Ib2f3aca08946e584156d092c37e1ea5ed5ca81a6
Closes-Bug: #1902998
'}]
commit_message:
Auto-remove floating agent gw ports on net/subnet delete

fip agent gw ports may be left in DB after router removal due to
race condition between l3 agent and server: when server processes
"router delete" - l3 agent is still processing "router add" and creates
fip agent gw port after server already removed the router.

The patch also adds handling of external network delete event
to cleanup fip namespaces left on agents due to same race condition.

Change-Id: Ib2f3aca08946e584156d092c37e1ea5ed5ca81a6
Closes-Bug: #1902998

commit_message:
simple-init: also remove en* interfaces from the images

Modern distros use more creative interface naming, e.g. CentOS 8
adds both eth0 and ens3 (!). Remove everything.

Change-Id: Ibdebdb09ea790787840cf9b817d4eb549ef18249

Add nic config conversion guidelines section

This adds a new section to provide guidelines for conversion
of old heat nic config templates to the new format consumed
with ansible.

Change-Id: I971f1976bc19dfa7f93fd30174d298508409ec0f

commit_message:
Keep 'provisioned' key in expanded roles

Only remove the 'provisioned' key from instances
in expanded roles if 'true'. If roles are to be
removed, the network ports module need to be told
to remove any provisioned neutron ports.

Change-Id: Ibe5507e23223d339f50cb2644fb69b94e411d3b8

commit_message:
Ensure tripleo ansible inventory file update is atomic

Multiple python-tripleoclient commands can run concurrently
and all attempt to update the same inventory file in
~/tripleo-ansible-inventory.yaml. Make the update atomic to
ensure the inventory file is always complete/valid.

Change-Id: I28628100e1300e789114af420bf3ea0dfe9c0d70
(cherry picked from commit 8e082f45ddfb8f29bd02feb1c9fd1ace4e9ec6dd)

commit_message:
Add support for vlan interfaces in dhcp-all-interfaces.sh

Provide ability to run dhcp client on VLAN interfaces created on
top of an Ethernet interface.  See also
<https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2008298>`__ for further details.

Change-Id: Ic3ffd7b8e23b1e996cfe6c79ce0ff47e521f30be

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-23 12:38:35.000000000', 'message': "Use correct Node id attribute

According to the openstacksdk docs[1] the Node uuid is stored in the
id attribute. This change removes the get_node shim which adds the
uuid attribute, and replaces any calls to Node.uuid with Node.id. This
will stop the many log debug warnings about this attribute:

    DEBUG openstack.resource [-] Attribute [uuid] not found in
    [<openstack.resource._ComponentManager object at 0x7f417e43aa20>]:
    'uuid'. __getattribute__ /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/openstack/resource.py:623

Calls to NodeInfo.uuid or db.Node.uuid remain unchanged.

Change-Id: Icd3de82877c6a53d32b4c9fd3e500d3cd9d7fb17
Story: 2008379
Task: 41300
(cherry picked from commit c387cf305cd69a09554273d14199464fa2373272)
"}]
commit_message:
Use correct Node id attribute

According to the openstacksdk docs[1] the Node uuid is stored in the
id attribute. This change removes the get_node shim which adds the
uuid attribute, and replaces any calls to Node.uuid with Node.id. This
will stop the many log debug warnings about this attribute:

    DEBUG openstack.resource [-] Attribute [uuid] not found in
    [<openstack.resource._ComponentManager object at 0x7f417e43aa20>]:
    'uuid'. __getattribute__ /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/openstack/resource.py:623

Calls to NodeInfo.uuid or db.Node.uuid remain unchanged.

Change-Id: Icd3de82877c6a53d32b4c9fd3e500d3cd9d7fb17
Story: 2008379
Task: 41300
(cherry picked from commit c387cf305cd69a09554273d14199464fa2373272)

[{'created': '2013-01-03 15:54:14.000000000', 'message': 'ZeroMQ socket creations in greenthreads

zeromq sockets are not greenlet safe
we have been creating them from the
main thread, passing them into
child greenthreads.

Fixes 1065532

Change-Id: I3ecba0847fc04838875e875fc5e6b10754e5dc18
'}]
commit_message:
ZeroMQ socket creations in greenthreads

zeromq sockets are not greenlet safe
we have been creating them from the
main thread, passing them into
child greenthreads.

Fixes 1065532

Change-Id: I3ecba0847fc04838875e875fc5e6b10754e5dc18

commit_message:
Remove neutron-tempest-{iptables_hybrid,linuxbridge} jobs from CI

This patch removes jobs:
neutron-tempest-linuxbridge
neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid
from the Neutron check and gate queues.

Most of the test run there are not backend dependent and they are run in
the neutron-tempest-multinode-full-py3 job too.
Some tests which may be impacted by different backend/firewall driver
are added to the neutron-tempest-plugin-scenario jobs now.

Additionally this patch removes also
neutron-tempest-plugin-dvr-multinode-scenario from the docs summary as
this job is not run in the check queue for some time now (it's moved to
the experimental queue).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/761410/
Change-Id: Ica669e05f719568dad74c4e8bd69ddceadccea7e

commit_message:
Remove tenant_id

The blueprint proposes to remove the API interface that uses
``tenant_id`` and replace it with ``project_id``, and changes
tenant to project in all docs, policies and code.

Part of blueprint remove-tenant-id

Change-Id: Ia7921745836a73b2507afc8173d13cce3d07726a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-19 17:14:31.000000000', 'message': "RFC: Update the install documents for cells and less distro specific

Recent discussions with deployment tool authors around how services
get default configurations has led to the realization that we need
some advice in our docs about which services get which config. The
install docs actually kinda already have that, although it's a bit
crufty. There is clearly no indication of what needs to happen for
multi-cell deployments, although controllers and computes are called
out separately, and the database config is excluded from the latter,
as needed.

This attempts to freshen some of those docs with mentions about services
potentially requiring different configs, along with which services
need what. It also puts some notes in place about compute not having
database access.

Finally, while working on this, I realized that we have three copies
of each controller/compute install doc, but the diff between them is
very small. It's clear that some docs have been updated over the
years and some have not (for example, the RedHat docs still
indicate that nova-api things should be configured on the compute nodes)
and the Ubuntu docs have not been updated for the systemd transisiton.

So, this removes the three, replaced with just the ubuntu one (which
appears to be the most up-to-date from a nova perspective). Some
distro-specific items are called out in the doc (like service names),
but I think in general, we should not try to document all the distro-
specific details, especially since that is not likely to age well
(re: the systemd transition from sixish years ago).

FIXME: This needs to de-ubuntu the filename, as well as fix up some
of the links that point to the distro-specific versions. I'm putting
this up as an RFC of sorts before I go to all that trouble.

Change-Id: Ic10f68e8c2b4691f5457ac786f48082dc7f087fd
Related-Bug: #1904179
"}, {'created': '2020-11-20 14:52:00.000000000', 'message': "RFC: Update the install documents for cells and less distro specific

of each controller/compute install doc, but the diff between them is
very small. It's clear that some docs have been updated over the
years and some have not (for example, the RedHat docs still
indicate that nova-api things should be configured on the compute nodes)
and the Ubuntu docs have not been updated for the systemd transisiton.

So, this removes the three, replaced with just the ubuntu one (which
appears to be the most up-to-date from a nova perspective). Some
distro-specific items are called out in the doc (like service names),
but I think in general, we should not try to document all the distro-
specific details, especially since that is not likely to age well
(re: the systemd transition from sixish years ago).

FIXME: This needs to de-ubuntu the filename, as well as fix up some
of the links that point to the distro-specific versions. I'm putting

Change-Id: Ic10f68e8c2b4691f5457ac786f48082dc7f087fd

"}]
commit_message:
RFC: Update the install documents for cells and less distro specific

Recent discussions with deployment tool authors around how services
get default configurations has led to the realization that we need
some advice in our docs about which services get which config. The
install docs actually kinda already have that, although it's a bit
crufty. There is clearly no indication of what needs to happen for
multi-cell deployments, although controllers and computes are called
out separately, and the database config is excluded from the latter,
as needed.

This attempts to freshen some of those docs with mentions about services
potentially requiring different configs, along with which services
need what. It also puts some notes in place about compute not having
database access.

Finally, while working on this, I realized that we have three copies
of each controller/compute install doc, but the diff between them is
very small. It's clear that some docs have been updated over the
years and some have not (for example, the RedHat docs still
indicate that nova-api things should be configured on the compute nodes)
and the Ubuntu docs have not been updated for the systemd transisiton.

So, this removes the three, replaced with just the ubuntu one (which
appears to be the most up-to-date from a nova perspective). Some
distro-specific items are called out in the doc (like service names),
but I think in general, we should not try to document all the distro-
specific details, especially since that is not likely to age well
(re: the systemd transition from sixish years ago).

FIXME: This needs to de-ubuntu the filename, as well as fix up some
of the links that point to the distro-specific versions. I'm putting
this up as an RFC of sorts before I go to all that trouble.

Change-Id: Ic10f68e8c2b4691f5457ac786f48082dc7f087fd

'}, {'created': '2020-11-03 11:33:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add os-volume_attachments reference docs

commit_message:
Add os-volume_attachments reference docs

This change adds a simple sequence diagram showing the flow of a volume
attachment between the various services, using the libvirt driver as an
example virt driver.

Change-Id: I631ac9de3d48aa0ad849f6615d0ad2052cb63e80

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/

Change-Id: Ie06d4e049e5e82fc0f75b8f3791b0b39594782b3

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-11 18:46:01.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0271468a19690503d2b91d20893dfaeb932d7348
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0271468a19690503d2b91d20893dfaeb932d7348

commit_message:
Add a test for Controller failover

- Check who is the leader
- Block the node that hosts the leader from accessing k8s API
- Check that that a new leader was chosen

Change-Id: I8471a00a37eb3dd93d912435fcff514d5d32df09
Depends-On: Iabebf14b64b9306e4ebc6ff827151feee27e5c11

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-17 15:00:15.000000000', 'message': "compute: Skip cinder_encryption_key_id check when booting from volume

Idf84ccff254d26fa13473fe9741ddac21cbcf321 added this check in order for
Nova to avoid booting encrypted images created by Cinder as there is
currently no support for using such images (rotating keys etc).

The check however missed the slightly convoluted use case where this
image property is found against a volume after the volume in question is
created using an encrypted image created by cinder from an encrypted
volume. In other words:

- Cinder creates an encrypted volume A
- Glance creates an encrypted image A from volume A
- Cinder creates an encrypted volume B from image A
- Nova attempts to boot an instance using volume B

Note that Nova may request the creation of volume B or a user could also
do this directly through Cinder.

As such this change simply ensures that the instance isn't booting from
a volume when preforming the check as it is only valid when booting from
an image.

Closes-Bug: #1895696
Change-Id: Ic92cab7362fa25050e5bbef5c3e360108365b5c7
(cherry picked from commit f9b67893acf94c06fd41be36b80b99788dc77e48)
"}]
commit_message:
compute: Skip cinder_encryption_key_id check when booting from volume

Idf84ccff254d26fa13473fe9741ddac21cbcf321 added this check in order for
Nova to avoid booting encrypted images created by Cinder as there is
currently no support for using such images (rotating keys etc).

The check however missed the slightly convoluted use case where this
image property is found against a volume after the volume in question is
created using an encrypted image created by cinder from an encrypted
volume. In other words:

- Cinder creates an encrypted volume A
- Glance creates an encrypted image A from volume A
- Cinder creates an encrypted volume B from image A
- Nova attempts to boot an instance using volume B

Note that Nova may request the creation of volume B or a user could also
do this directly through Cinder.

As such this change simply ensures that the instance isn't booting from
a volume when preforming the check as it is only valid when booting from
an image.

Closes-Bug: #1895696
Change-Id: Ic92cab7362fa25050e5bbef5c3e360108365b5c7
(cherry picked from commit f9b67893acf94c06fd41be36b80b99788dc77e48)

commit_message:
Dep's should be restricted by tox-constraints

Tox trying to install latest versions for building docs which may
not be supported by stable and lower branches, so should be
restricted by respective version's tox-constraints.txt

Change-Id: Iecd29788d1c94fd727072aa5dd7fe5d828dbf174

commit_message:
Generate ansible.cfg for UC/standalone deployments

Add CLI command that allows to generate and manually
customize the default ansible configuration used with
UC/standalone deployments. Use the config generator
from tripleo common ansible actions for that.

If there is no pre-created user's ansible.cfg in
--output-dir, generate the default one with as a part of
the deployment command.

Depends-On: Ie7dd9039ee74aac046679e831ffda143257e3825
Change-Id: I695916e9271392127635834078e57655857182f1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

According to the openstacksdk docs[1] the Node uuid is stored in the
id attribute. This change removes the get_node shim which adds the
uuid attribute, and replaces any calls to Node.uuid with Node.id. This
will stop the many log debug warnings about this attribute:

    DEBUG openstack.resource [-] Attribute [uuid] not found in
    [<openstack.resource._ComponentManager object at 0x7f417e43aa20>]:
    'uuid'. __getattribute__ /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/openstack/resource.py:623

Calls to NodeInfo.uuid or db.Node.uuid remain unchanged.

Change-Id: Icd3de82877c6a53d32b4c9fd3e500d3cd9d7fb17
Story: 2008379
Task: 41300
"}]
commit_message:
Use correct Node id attribute

According to the openstacksdk docs[1] the Node uuid is stored in the
id attribute. This change removes the get_node shim which adds the
uuid attribute, and replaces any calls to Node.uuid with Node.id. This
will stop the many log debug warnings about this attribute:

    DEBUG openstack.resource [-] Attribute [uuid] not found in
    [<openstack.resource._ComponentManager object at 0x7f417e43aa20>]:
    'uuid'. __getattribute__ /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/openstack/resource.py:623

Calls to NodeInfo.uuid or db.Node.uuid remain unchanged.

Change-Id: Icd3de82877c6a53d32b4c9fd3e500d3cd9d7fb17
Story: 2008379
Task: 41300

commit_message:
Revert "Add support for UBI8 as a subcase of Centos8"

This reverts commit e210f1265f29a6bc7057d84912438a45a90d8c33.

Reason for revert: It caused issues in container build jobs,
issue didn't got caught in CI as build jobs are not running in
tripleo-repos, can be re revert with fix post jobs are added.

Change-Id: If8807e704e7e3c48dea3645cf95f56a0970e7736

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
they are not needed during installation.

Change-Id: I941c2247692a74e0fd0fb350135f8610af11d7bb

commit_message:
Add regression test for bug #1895696

NOTE(lyarwood): I6daea47988181dfa6dde3d9c42004c0ecf6ae87a isn't present
on stable/ussuri so this test now uses the fake_image_service.
1f81c086579a0867f9aecd2d5d7cc531b4d3347f also isn't present on
stable/ussuri so this test also uses the CinderFixture directly.

Related-Bug: #1895696
Change-Id: I15271fb0b8de7f1184acddd607d605837e2eb7d4
(cherry picked from commit e76cccddd3ac64d8cc3e7e63e1772d5d23f20669)

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated

Remove deprecated tail_log function

This function has been deprecated for a long time, let's finally
remove it. It is only generating a warning anyway.

commit_message:
Shutdown VM before destructive update action

- Shutdown VM before a profile update is performed if the VM is in
active state.

- Start VM after profile update is completed if the VM is in shutdown
state.

- Update health policy to be disabled before cluster update, cluster
recover and cluster node replace and enabled again after the operation
has completed.

- Add cluster.stop_timeout_before_update cluster config option to
specify custom timeout for shutting down a VM as part of profile update.

Change-Id: I9744a1c7990e7a01efe5f9e200eddc920916b4ac

commit_message:
Add support for UBI8 as a subcase of Centos8

Add ubi8 as a supported --distro.
Since container-selinux is likely will be required but not available
via UBI AppStream, add the CentOS-8 AppStream repo (no gpg checks) as
well.
Since other packages might be also available only from CentOS-Base,
add that repos for UBI as well.

In order to make it working without collisions, also account for
/etc/distro.repos.d paths.

Change-Id: I4398a143ee8ef3e506e98a7c613871918d0acb9d
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

We need this in stable/ussuri so that we can release 1.67.3

PyMySQL >=0.1.0 supports python2 and to support that version we need a new release for the 1.67.x series of tooz'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-10-02 10:14:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

PyMySQL >= 0.10.0'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-10-02 11:11:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-10-02 11:13:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I wondering if we need to backport these changes, PyMySQL's upper-constraints for ussuri is settle to 0.9.3 [1], but on the other hand tooz doesn't have `lower-constraints` so I'm not sure which version will be pulled here.

Are these changes are compatible with version 0.9.3?
If yes then we can continue with that.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/src/branch/stable/ussuri/upper-constraints.txt#L708"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-10-02 11:33:03.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-10-02 14:40:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is for Gnocchi which is a third-party application using Tooz, the stable releases needs to support python2 so must use Tooz<2.0.0 but had PyMySQL unpinned. I will pin PyMySQL<0.10.0 in Gnocchi so we could abandon this but IMO it's a valid fix to support a later version of PyMySQL (which still supports python2)"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-10-05 14:16:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think we should merge this if we expect tooz to be used outside of openstack (which we seem to).'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-10-05 14:17:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fix broken CI and PyMySQL support

This is a combination of two patches that depend on 
each other to fix a breakage with PyMySQL 0.10.0 and
fixing the up the CI to a working state.

1. Blacklist etcd3gw 0.2.6

etcd3gw 0.2.6 was blacklisted in openstack/requirements [0], because
that version has a bug [1].

tooz does not use openstack/requirements' upper constraints, so the
same blacklisting needs to be introduced here in setup.cfg.

[0] Icb6873d8c5d3a3624c0ac3d76fc9125c5d8134b2
[1] https://github.com/dims/etcd3-gateway/issues/41

Change-Id: I22b955419014dd34c63e406c488e0636ffe9013b
Closes-Bug: #1891314
(cherry picked from commit 3f0759091c9fddf4d1486188015fc526e66cd73e)
(cherry picked from commit c8d77ee485746c4367528e542063d5a045c4b6f3)

2. Fix breakage with PyMySQL 0.10.0

In this version a Connection is no longer a context manager. Fix
it by simply getting a Cursor out of it (locks don't seem to
interact with transactions, at least according to MariaDB docs).

Change-Id: I5ea06ebd2b976465ff82f10a74e140f30e9e803f
(cherry picked from commit d59b283440e96959e6ad1b9ce2aa154c31e71480)

still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in

commit_message:
[senlin] Transition Stein to EM

This transition the stein branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: I15cf76a1055a5fda8cac8abca321b8056b28b0fa

commit_message:
Add support for GlusterFS NFS Manila backend

Follows existing backends patterns to add support for the GlusterFS
NFS driver.
NFS server type used by the GlusterFS backend, Gluster or Ganesha,
currently supports Gluster.
The GlusterFS NFS driver needs to install the glusterfs-fuse package
in the kolla images manila share container in advance, which has been merged
in https://review.opendev.org/747510

commit_message:
Lock sg updates while in _apply_port_filter()

Add a locking mechanism so that security_groups_member_updated event
processing is blocked if another thread is in the process of applying
port filters.  This avoids a race condition where security group
membership updates are incorrectly discarded when they arrive between
retrieving port details and registering the port with the firewall
driver.

See https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1887405 for complete
details.

Bug: 1887405
Change-Id: I6e4abe13a7541c21399466c5eb0d61ff5780c887

commit_message:
Bump minimum pip version

As we found with Ie3f967d27b03a9594d54e8dd413f61daa65a73f3, any lower
than ~8 has issues with constraints; this is very out of date.  Bump
to the current release.  (Follow-on to
Ic7d0c04d7fa77774ab2d70fb9d11f182becec553)

Change-Id: I233386444e5706542d3d1ff1e7144454a5271f21

commit_message:
Fix dynamic-login with grub2

Grub2 messes up arguments with double quotes in them, changing from
key="value" to "key=value" [1]. Support this format as well.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=950760

Change-Id: Icf4c9f86009d29a342d6e0e21644af680066b0b2

subject: Skip Trilio dirs when setting ownership in /var/lib/nova
messages: [{'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2020-11-18 18:08:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-11-18 20:39:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-11-19 14:45:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2020-11-23 04:01:31.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as I56c8fb1393ff1f38edb4077b1d3264f729893052'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-18 18:08:58.000000000', 'message': 'Skip Trilio dirs when setting ownership in /var/lib/nova

Trilio currently mounts an NFS export in /var/lib/nova to make it accessible
from within the nova_compute and nova_libvirt containers.
This can result in considerable delays when walking the directory tree to
ensure the ownership is correct.

This patch adds the ability to skip paths when recursively setting the
ownership and selinux context in /var/lib/nova. The list of paths to skip
can be set via te NovaStatedirOwnershipSkip heat parameter. This default to
the Trilio dir.

Change-Id: Ic6f053d56194613046ae0a4a908206ebb453fcf4
(cherry picked from commit c156534010cf27d6cca0407962d1dbc484717410)
(cherry picked from commit fbc55f02f21a600b3a9ca5c20c20794ad2ca86a4)
(cherry picked from commit c352a78fe0ceef2a77728c46bb08ac4f12217842)
(cherry picked from commit f318e4e2dfe9fd087b1d01259a9942f5034b6296)
'}]
commit_message:
Skip Trilio dirs when setting ownership in /var/lib/nova

Trilio currently mounts an NFS export in /var/lib/nova to make it accessible
from within the nova_compute and nova_libvirt containers.
This can result in considerable delays when walking the directory tree to
ensure the ownership is correct.

This patch adds the ability to skip paths when recursively setting the
ownership and selinux context in /var/lib/nova. The list of paths to skip
can be set via te NovaStatedirOwnershipSkip heat parameter. This default to
the Trilio dir.

Change-Id: Ic6f053d56194613046ae0a4a908206ebb453fcf4
(cherry picked from commit c156534010cf27d6cca0407962d1dbc484717410)
(cherry picked from commit fbc55f02f21a600b3a9ca5c20c20794ad2ca86a4)
(cherry picked from commit c352a78fe0ceef2a77728c46bb08ac4f12217842)
(cherry picked from commit f318e4e2dfe9fd087b1d01259a9942f5034b6296)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-18 20:45:56.000000000', 'message': "Add policy file selection logic when default changing to yaml

As part of community goal[1], each services are changing the default
value of 'CONF.oslo_policy.policy_file' config option from 'policy.json'
to 'policy.yaml'. oslo policy select the default value from
CONF.oslo_policy.policy_file which will be policy.yaml as service will
start changing the default. To avoid breaking the existing deployment which
are relying on old default (policy.json) file, a new fallback logic
is implemented. If new default file 'policy.yaml' does not exist but old
default 'policy.json' exist then fallback to use old default file.

Each services are going to add upgrade checks and warnings for using JSON
formatted policy file so in future we cna remove this fallback logic.

This logic was done in nova in Victoria cycle when nova changed the
default value - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/748059/ . Moving this
to oslo policy side will avoid the duplication on services side.

Also it provides a flag to disable this fallback.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: If72b2fcc3cfd8116b575ed7b9e3870df634fd9af

to oslo policy side will avoid the duplication on services side.

Also it provides a flag to disable this fallback.

Change-Id: If72b2fcc3cfd8116b575ed7b9e3870df634fd9af

commit_message:
Add policy file selection logic when default changing to yaml

As part of community goal[1], each services are changing the default
value of 'CONF.oslo_policy.policy_file' config option from 'policy.json'
to 'policy.yaml'. oslo policy select the default value from
CONF.oslo_policy.policy_file which will be policy.yaml as service will
start changing the default. To avoid breaking the existing deployment which
are relying on old default (policy.json) file, a new fallback logic
is implemented. If new default file 'policy.yaml' does not exist but old
default 'policy.json' exist then fallback to use old default file.

Each services are going to add upgrade checks and warnings for using JSON
formatted policy file so in future we cna remove this fallback logic.

This logic was done in nova in Victoria cycle when nova changed the
default value - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/748059/ . Moving this
to oslo policy side will avoid the duplication on services side.

Also it provides a flag to disable this fallback.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Change-Id: If72b2fcc3cfd8116b575ed7b9e3870df634fd9af

Change-Id: I8a82e852b389f3499e32f822cd7aa9e5792ea7c6

commit_message:
nodepool: remove openedge completely

Although the servers are turned down to 0, the lack of response from
the cloud is causing problems for nodepool-builder trying to upload
images.  Remove the entries completely to avoid this.

Change-Id: I8a82e852b389f3499e32f822cd7aa9e5792ea7c6

commit_message:
Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

Remove babel.cfg as well, this is the default role and not needed
anymore.

also remove Babel from requirements[1]
[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014227.html

Change-Id: I19c4181f8fbfd0ebd5e3def9cdc92b95885ff221

commit_message:
Move Placement under Nova's governance

As it was discussed on the Wallaby PTG[1][2] it was agreed that the
Placement project is moved back under Nova due to not having separate
leadership available for Placement[3].

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/nova-wallaby-ptg
[2] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-wallaby-ptg

commit_message:
Fix AttributeError in the project instance detail view

The previous code does not handle a case where admin-specific attributes
do not exist. This leads to AttributeError in the project instance detail
page as these attributes are not included in the response from nova API.

Change-Id: I4c2942960259782d47c6777394dec6888959e26c
Closes-Bug: #1905024
